Visited late at night on a Thursday and there was a line of 50 people hardly moving...decided to buy pints and skip the line.  Got three flavors - Straw tres leches, Salted honey marshmallow w/ walnuts, and Almond brittle w/salted ganache.  

All three flavors were awful.  Both too sweet and salty at the same time!!!  Couldn't eat more than a spoonful of each one.  What a waste of $33 and my hope for delicious ice cream.
author: Elouise D.

description: Waited about half an hour in line after dinner for some ice cream dessert. Love that they let you try however many flavors you want in order to make an informed decision, haha! I got the double scoop of lavender. Definitely did not need two scoops. Interesting and unique flavors. $7 for double, $5 for one in a cup. Would return, but not with a wait.
author: Marie D.

description:
Of course we started with the line. Stayed in line for about 15-20 mins.  It takes a while because everyone can sample as many flavors as they want. 
I've tasted the bone marrow flavor. I love bone marrow as a savory dish. I wouldn't imagine it on anything sweet. Verdict: it's meh. 
I ended up getting the Olive Oil and Lemon Custard and the Honey Lavender.  My boys got the Double Fold Vanilla, Chocolate Gooey Brownie, Roasted Strawberry Très Lèches and Honey Rocky Road. 
Overall, the flavors are bold and the ice cream creamy, not too sweet and was delightful.  I had to compare it with my neighborhood ice cream shops to warrant the trek in the city. Living super close to Scoop and Tin Pot microcreameries got us spoiled for great ice creams. But I'm afraid to say, Tin Pot Microcreamery still tops them with one star.  The consistency at Tin Pot is better than Salt and Straw. 
Thankful for the recent heat wave. I paid no attention to the guilty feeling of indulging on ice cream.  It was a necessity at this point. ;-P
author: Maria G.

description: so glad that salt & straw is now in sf! have had it in portland a couple times, and i've been to the fillmore location twice now, and last night after state bird there was barely a wait - amaze. i usually go for the chocolate-themed flavors and skip anything fruity, but i havent had a bad bite here.  beware, the scoops are definitely more expensive than in portland, because sf mkt price!
author: Christina L.

description: Awesome Portland, Oregon creamery that everyone needs to try. The salted caramel ribbon ice cream is awesome. I loved the hazelnut hot fudge Sunday!
author: Kym P.

description: Finally tried out this ice cream shop.  I've been passing it for a few weeks and getting whiffs of the delicious smells.  The line has died down substantially since it first opened, which I was thankful for.  It took us about 10 minutes to get to the front of the line where we were greeted by a friendly employee who asked if we wanted any samples as she led us to an empty section of the counter.  They had a lot of unique delicious sound flavors, but we ended up picking the salted caramel, salted honey with marshmallow, and the chocolate with brownies.  An added bonus is that they offer the option of getting a split scoop so that you can enjoy two flavors even if you want just one scoop.  The price is pretty steep for ice cream so definitely will be an occasional treat for me, but it's certainly worth a try!
author: Gloria N.

description: Management reached out in regards to my feeling towards unfair scoop sizes, and offered to send me a gift card to buy another one on them. GREAT service in this regard!
author: Susanna C.

description: AHH I'm so happy that I tried this place!  It was talked about so much and I love ice cream.  When my friend and I went the line wasn't too long!  The staff was so nice and allowed us to try as many samples as we wanted.  I opted for one of the specials of the month - rhubarb crumble with toasted anise.  It was sooooo good!  Knowing that they make it from scratch made it even better.  I'm a huge fan of Smitten ice cream but I have to say this topped it.  I definitely will be coming back!!! & I highly recommend to come here if you're in San Francisco wanting a sweet treat!
author: Mikayla M.

description:
This place has expensive ice cream. This place has long lines. This place also the best lemon flavored ice cream I have ever had, no question. (Their other flavors are pretty good too, but if you ask me, lemon is where it's at.)

This is one of those rare places that is worth going out of your way for, worth waiting in line for, worth shelling out a few extra bucks for. 

Just promise me that if you go you taste the lemon. You'll thank me later. :)
author: Shoole S.

description: Went here with a few friends right at the end of May so we got to try the May seasonal flavors. I got the seasonal Rhubarb Crumble with Toasted Anise and the regular Peach Vinegar Cobbler with Toasted Nutmeg. They both were absolutely amazing and worth the trek out to Pacific Heights. They both tasted like pie in ice cream form which I was super into. There was basically jam and pie crust in the ice cream but the ice cream still shined through. Definitely looking forward to the June flavors!
author: Isabel C.

description: This ice cream is delicious! A friend took us here we were so happy. They have both typical flavors as well as some new and interesting combinations. Definitely worth the trip!
author: CJ F.

description: Unique/wide variety of ice cream flavors, you're bound to find something you like! There are some flavors I absolutely love, such as roasted strawberry tres leche and their pots of gold and rainbows (basically lucky charms cereal for ice cream). They offer unique monthly flavors (for instance, for October, they had chocolate covered grasshoppers and toffee mealworms) as well as their classical flavors. The waffle cones can be a hit or miss. I've been served stale tasting waffle cones on one day and great tasting ones on some other days (star taken off for inconsistency).
author: Lucy Q.

description: A touch too sweet, but the fact that they let you taste all of them (if you want) brings it back to an even 5. All sorts of flavors, from cheese berry to curry to vanilla (lol). PS if you go here for vanilla, you're doing it wrong. There wasn't a big line when we went, but I can see how the line can get huge. It's in a cute area too, so you can walk around with your ice cream or just stay in and enjoy the shop.
author: Samir K.

description: There was a line out the door, and some great flavors on the menu. They let you sample their flavors so it's good to grab a menu and decide. Their spooktacular flavors are interesting and make sure to try because it might not be to your taste.
author: J L.

description: This ice cream is overpriced and average at best.  The vanilla is dull and sugary. The cookie dough taste like something other than cookie dough. I just don't get the hype but then again most people are clueless.  You want real ice cream go to Swenson's on Union and Hyde.  But for you lemmings who like waiting in line for average go at it!
author: Jason M.

description:
Good ice cream.  Great service.  Super busy to plan ahead.  
No bathroom so if you have little people look for Pete's down the road if you have a b-room emergency like we did.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: Quick ice cream stop after lunch! My favorite flavor at this location is the Strawberry Tres Leche! If you like some texture in your bite from strawberry slices to cake in your ice cream, this is the right flavor for you!
author: Daisy L.

description:
There's a movement in the ice cream world using high quality local ingredients and Salt and Straw is up there with the best in the country. It may even rival McConnell's out of Santa Barbara for the best ice cream on the west coast. 

Every month salt and straw releases new seasonal flavors and we were fortunate to try the entire Spooktacular tasting. All of the flavors are unique and I think it may be the best Strawberry ice cream I've ever had. 

They have three locations that I know of, the original location in Portland, here in San Fran and the one on Abbot Kinney blvd in Venice Beach, but there may be more. Definitely have to try!
author: Alex L.

description: I consider myself an ice cream connoisseur, and Salt & Straw has the best ice cream I've ever had. Try the pots of gold & rainbow flavor in a waffle cone. You won't be disappointed.
author: Emily R.

description: I'm definitely not an ice cream lover. I never eat ice cream but my daughter dragged me to this place and beg me to try different flavours. And I'm glad I did. They had flavours such as black olives brittles and goat cheese or honey lavender. At first, the taste was a bit strange but it was delicious. I will definitely recommend to try some of their unusual flavours before ordering . I don't think this place needs publicity since the queue was soooo long...Definitely worth it!
author: Laurence D.

description:
The best ice cream in San Francisco. Friendly employee's, wild exotic flavors and you never feel rushed -- taste all you want. Yes, there's a ine out the door but it is well worth the wait. It was my daughter's birthday and when our server found out, she comped our whole order (wow, I totally didn't see that coming!) For that alone I would come back here and recommend this place, despite the cost, but honestly, the actual ice cream was divine and the waffle cones were delicious. 

Rich, creamy chocolatey goodness. How can you go wrong on a warm summer's night?
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Seriously people. How can you be waiting in line around the block for this place??? The ice cream has some interesting flavors but it's all way too sweet ! 3 stars for the staff who all seem really nice, and for having a pint line.

For my money , smitten is better... however the staff there aren't as great, (a few times they looked at me like I was nuts for asking for a bag, and they have no pint line).

Neither is worth much more than a 5 minute wait I'm afraid.
author: vivace K.

description:
I'm glad I don't have to visit Portland to get my fix.

The flavors are good but they tend to go overboard with the multiple sweet ingredients.
author: Evan W.

description: So. Freaking. Amazing. Do I love this ice cream! The service is fantastic, they are always smiling and I love they offer samples since the flavors are unique. You can totally taste the quality in every bite. The salted Carmel almond ganache is definitely my favorite. Love taking people here when they come visit SF.
author: brittany g.

description: My favorite is the Honey Lavender because you can taste both the honey and the lavender pretty distinctly and it reminds me of curling up in a warm fuzzy blanket at a spa :)  The Baobob was surprisingly tasty, but I recommend trying it before you try the others or drinking some water first so you can taste the unique flavor.  The sightglass coffee was too bitter for my taste, but coffee lovers will not be disappointed.  Don't be fooled by the line around the block.  It moves fast!  You can also skip the line and buy pints, but then you'll miss out on the opportunity to try samples..
author: Annie R.

description: Pretty long lines but moves quickly. We came 10-15 min before closing and you could tell they were trying to service the line as quickly as possible!! After tasting a few of the flavors, I decided on one of their limited edition flavors - goat cheese marionberry habanero. It was spicy and delicious!!!! Minus 1 star for the waffle cone being a bit tough and not as fresh as I would've liked. Interesting flavors, friendly service!
author: Yin H.

description:
Salt & Straw did not disappoint! We got lucky as the line was only three peeps deep. 

FOOD: Handmade ice cream using local organic ingredients - very tasty and smooth. Yes you can sample as many flavors you'd like - everyone is friendly and willing to offer samples! We got the Sea Salt with Caramel Ribbons and Almond Brittle with Salted Ganache - their #1 and #2 most popular flavors. 

SERVICE: We met Mary the manager (she is the store manager of one of their Portland stores sent here to help with operations of their grand opening) and she made our experience unforgettable - so friendly, knowledgeable, and so passionate about the ice cream! Thank you, Mary! :)

PARKING: Street parking only.
author: T L.

description: Every flavor tastes the same to me. Line is insanely wrong. Prices are horrendous. Go do yourself a favor and get a pint of Lemon Cookie from the Three Twins. $3.75 for that. Or feel free to drop $10+ for some ubiquitous sweet mass on a cone.
author: Matt H.

description: Yum! Long line but the delish samples kept coming. It was a hot day but no one seemed to mind the wait. I got the almond toffee, daughter got the peach cobbler. Both were excellent! The seasonal lavender/honey and strawberry coconut would've been great choices too. Not a lot of room to sit but you end up really happy so who cares. Great neighborhood vibe too!
author: M S.

description:
Nothing draws a crowd like a crowd, they say, and I'm now more certain that's the only thing keeping this place so packed. It's what drew me here! 

I was recently here with three friends and after a 40 minute wait in line we all took a few bites of our ice cream, and ALL FOUR of us - each with a different flavor - threw it away. For the (exorbitant and ridiculously expensive) price, you could take a cab to Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe and not only have money left over, but enjoy far superior ice cream. 

Salt & Straw, we wanted to like you, and your employees are amazing, but your ice cream is basically just frozen colored sugar. All four of us were in full agreement that the ice cream is TOO SWEET. 

Three stars for the kind staff, but if you're going to splurge on a calorie-bomb like ice cream at a place with a long line, go elsewhere.
author: Pete J.

description:
Had to endure long wait time
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet after how many times I've visited
I totally fell in love with their ice cream and unique flavors
author: James M.

description: This is the best ice cream  I have ever had in my entire life! The first time I tried it was in Los Angeles at the Larchmont location. The second time in San Francisco and they were equally consistent in terms of flavor and consistency. I had the honey lavender flavor and it is my favorite. I dream about it. The service is exceptional even though it is very busy and the line can be out the door sometimes. It was well worth the wait. I highly recommend  trying it.
author: Sherri P.

description:
went on a thursday night around 8:30pm. the line wasn't too bad, and it was helped by the fact that some of the scoopers offer samples to people in line to help it move along faster.

i liked the strawberry tres leches, especially since the cake was still intact and tender but not soggy. i was looking for something a bit less decadent, and would have liked more strawberry, so i passed on that one.

i tried the teranga baobab juice and coconut, which was a vegan one. the hibiscus and ginger sounded good, but i found it lacking in those flavors and wish it was more strongly flavored.

i ended up doing a split single scoop ($5.50) of the meyer lemon with blueberry and peach cobbler with nutmeg. the meyer lemon tasted tarter and better as a sample than a full scoop. the peach cobbler was spice-y (not spicy), and i loved the bits of cobbler. i wished there was more peaches though.

the texture of everything was really creamy.

overall i found myself wishing that all of the ones i tried were more fruity in flavor. good, but i want to be hit over the head with lemon and blueberry if it's called such, you know? fun to try out, but i'd recommend garden creamery (in the mission) or polly ann (in the sunset) for more flavorful ice creams.
author: Heather F.

description:
Superior product.

Obscene prices.

Yes, I'm familiar with the issues in offering such a treat. You can buy a meal within that neighborhood for the same amount of money.

Yes, excellent ice cream.
author: Kevin M.

description: Awesome ice cream blends!  Worth the calories to feed my craving
author: Frank S.

description:
Discovered this place in Portland and we're so excited they came to SF!
We didn't mind waiting in line. The staff is efficient.
Had the salted Carmel and could eat it every day! Amazing!!
author: Dave S.

description: Overall I like the idea of this place. They have very unique flavors. I tried a few different flavors but couldn't find one I really liked. I love goat cheese and thought maybe I'd like that one but it was overwhelming. I also have a really sweet tooth (28 to be exact (no wisdom teeth)) and the chocolate was far too sweet for me. The guy working there at the time was really kind though and didn't seem bothered at all by letting us try several flavors. I'd still go back for when they change up the flavors if I didn't live 3,000 miles away!
author: Christina B.

description: My favorite ice cream place in the Bay Area. The line can get really long after dinnertime, but they are really efficient. They offer you samples while you wait in line, so there isn't that bottleneck at the counter. They have rotating seasonal flavors, but I've tried about 4 different ones and have loved them all! The waffle cones are also amazing and really add to the treat. I usually get a kid's scoop in a waffle cone, which is the perfect amount for me. The serving sizes are pretty generous.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
DAMNIT. I SO wanted to hate this place!! Or at least to tell all of yelp that it must be a front for nefarious Ice Cream Mafia activity, because I can't think of any other reason for the beyond-exorbitant prices they charge and the round-the-corner line at every hour of the day (including 5 minutes before closing). 

But it really IS the best ice cream I've ever had. Stood in line for 15 minutes and didn't move an inch (partly because a girl in the store tried EIGHT different samples before buying a cone--they don't put a cap on samples here which is awesome if you a.) can't make up your mind b.) want to stick it to the man by eating all your ice cream in tiny-spoon-sizes rather than actually buying anything, c.) intensely annoy everyone else in the line who are watching you through the window and angrily giggling. So I ran in and grabbed a pint of Gooey Chocolate Brownie for a whopping $11 (because FYI you can skip the line to buy a pint) and brought it home, preparing to grimace and announce that the Ice Cream Gangsters wouldn't rope ME into their racket. 

But they did. God that is the best ice cream ever. I would pay $20 for a pint. I seriously hope no one at Salt and Straw reads that and thinks "mwahahaha, let's raise the prices!" but it's true. I ate it and then went to bed and then had a DREAM about eating it.

Sigh. Viva la Ice Cream Mafia per sempre!!!!
author: Ali M.

description: Gotta make a stop any time I'm near a Salt & Straw!  Thank you for the gluten-free/dairy-free options!
author: Aly B.

description:
I loovee Salt & Straw ice cream!!

Whenever I visit Portland, I would get ice cream from here every day.  Love the unique flavors, taste, and portion sizes here.  Of their regular flavors, my favorites are the Sea Salt with Caramel Ribbons and the Almond Brittle with Salted Ganache.  However, my all time favorite flavor is the Great Candycopia (found in October).  I tried the Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches flavor (unique to SF) and it was pretty good.  It's great that they have additional new flavors every month which makes them unique.
The only thing I dislike about this particular location is the parking; but at least you can grab a pint to go and skip the line.

I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream :)
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
By far my favorite ice cream shop! There's so many good, not to mention interesting, flavors; coconut with baobab juice sorbet and olive oil with lemon custard are my favorite flavors. I'd recommend whatever they have for their monthly special though - May's raspberry liqueur with edible flowers was really good.

To get more for your buck, I would always suggest getting their waffle cone, double scoop. That shit will be good for two people; but better for one. 

Service is 10/10, kindest and coolest people!
author: Dank M.

description:
I was super excited when I heard Portland's favorite a.k.a. Salt & Straw was coming to town! I've had it when I was visiting Portland and I fell in love. The flavors were so interestingly delicious, and it's different in each location, gearing towards partnering with local shops! 

I guess I was lucky that I waited for less than one hour because it was a cold and rainy day. But that didn't stop me.. Ice cream should and can be consume during any season. But anyways, I love how accommodating they are about trying all the different flavors. Don't be shy and just try! If you can't decide, get a flight! For me, I really liked the Roasted Strawberry because it tasted like strawberry cheesecake (mmmmm). I also got the honey lavender, too. It was different and I really like that bold lavender flavor. If you're a coffee love, do try their coffee flavor because it's in collaboration with Sightglass Coffee and Dandelion Chocolate here in SF! How cool is that?!

Overall, the hype is very real and I'm down to wait for more ice cream. Until next time!
author: Wendy Y.

description:
The line here is wacky! We waited about 30 minutes on a Sunday night, which was longer than the time I came here on a Sunday a few weeks prior (must be gaining traction).

Once you make it through the line, however, the service is great. The servers are happy to let you try flavors even if you're nervous to take up too much of their time. I recommend trying some of the interesting savory flavors that you might not want a whole scoop of.

Their junior scoops are a good size for me! Plus you can "split" a junior scoop and get two flavors, which isn't an option at some places. This scoop still makes for a sizable cone. The ice cream is super rich and creamy. I like hot fudge on my scoops, and I noticed here they go a little easy on it (so you might wanna ask for extra if you're like me).

Pricing is comparable to birite and Mitchell's. Overall, Mitchell's still takes the cake for me (I think their line moves a little faster too), but I won't turn down a trip to salt & straw.
author: Anna M.

description:
I write this review somewhat dolefully.  For nearly 6 months, I have waited for S&S to open up on Fillmore. I read incredibly reviews about the other stores and how amazing their ice cream is.  I'll start to say that their store is in a great location on a happening street.  The line was around the corner (probably 30-50 people waiting?), so I bypassed the line to buy a fresh pint.  I painstakingly waited until later that night after dinner to open the pint to see what fortunes lie in wait.  Unfortunately, the ice cream was entirely mediocre.  Like, less than store bought of a mid-tier brand like Breyers.  To boot, it was $11 for a pint, which is actually ludicrous, even in San Francisco.  

I will definitely not be going back here.
author: Robert P.

description: I am so happy to have Salt and Straw here in San Francisco! The company ethos seems as good as the ice cream and the combination makes me a happy customer.
author: Christine H.

description:
This is literally peak modern San Francisco.

Lines are ridiculously long.
Ice cream is incredibly expensive.

It's ICE CREAM people.

Don't get me wrong - it ain't bad. But at $11/pint, it should come with a servant to scoop it for you and gently wipe your face when done.

But hey, if you are already spending $4 on toast at the Mill, this place should be perfect for your dessert. Just UberXL your way over here, and enjoy!

Eleven dollars. Ice cream.
author: Jeremy T.

description: Went on a sat afternoon and the line was around the building. However, it took less than half an hour to get to order. They were really nice and let us try as many flavors as we wanted. We ended up getting the strawberry tres leches and the sightglass coffee with dandelion chocolate. Both are phenomenal flavors. It's a bit on the pricier side but I think it's better than the other ice cream shops in town (can't believe I just wrote that). Well worth it if you can wait in line.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Best ice cream I've ever had. 

Service: 5/5 I liked how they let you taste test the ice cream before you're even ordering. They were quick once we got through the crazy line. (Don't worry though. It was worth the long wait.)

Ambience: 5/5 It is a really cute ice cream joint. The decor is great, aesthetically pleasing.

Food: 5/5
The Teranga Baobab Juice and Coconut was a very unique flavor but very rich and delicious. You can taste the ginger and coconut, and they go together really well. 
The sightglass coffee was really good. 
The peach vinegar cobbler was even better. It was really rich with a hint of nutmeg, the perfect touch. It was the perfect blend of tang and sweetness, with added crunch from actual peach cobbler. 
The apple pie was good to an extent. The taste of the cinnamon and other spices was good, but the apple flavor was kinda off. To be fair, the employee explained that they used an apple substitute, not actual apples. 
The sea salt and caramel was amazing. Period. Good mix of salt and sweet with the twist of it being sea salt ice cream with caramel added. 
Finally, the banana bread pudding was incredible. It was a unique ice cream flavor, yet so familiar. The best I have ever had. 

The Salt and Straw is somewhere you have to try at least once. It only makes it more appealing because their flavors change every month
author: Jayna J.

description: Super yummy but like sometimes it's totally over the top like almost weird like explosion in your like mouth. Then other times the unfamiliar combinations hit just the right salty sweet spot and it's like creamica orgasmica on ice.
author: Ronald P.

description:
This place is absolutely fantastic. The line is out the door but it moved fairly quickly. You are able to sample as many flavors as possible (which leads to the long lines but is so worth it as they have so many unique flavors).  The staff is so friendly and helpful, and the ice cream is so delicious! I ordered the sea salt caramel in a waffle cone - I swear, the waffle cones are the best I've ever had. The ice cream is so creamy. 

I also sampled the strawberry tres leches (tasty, it was like a strawberry shortcake flavor) as well as the seasonal rhubarb (not my favorite, it was fairly tart). Friend had the olive oil and lemon and loved it.
author: Ashlee C.

description: Yum! Worth the wait. Great vegan options and amazing flavor combinations. Splurge and get the waffle cone. Ps unlimited samples !
author: Carly A.

description: Love this spot and the staff! They are always more than willing to let you try anything and everything you are curious about as well as are more than happy to give suggestions. Would, and do recommend to all my friends.
author: Antonia D.

description:
Best ice cream you will find in the city. This is an awesome place, originally from Portland and have shops in LA as well. 

Just be prepared for a long line.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Dispute the long long long long , I mean super duper long line at this grand opening Ice Cream shop on fillmore. I highly recommend it!!
I didn't stand in line, instead, walked straight in and bought 2 pint of ice cream! ( you don't have to wait in line to purchase a pint!! just grab your desired flavor and head toward the register!!!
I never tried Honey Lavender, and boy.. it was not an disappointment !! 
It taste like Earl Grey Tea with a hint of sweetness!!

Will go back to try other flavors when the line isn't long!
author: Anney T.

description:
Saw this place first on Instagram right before they opened the SF location which, if you follow them, will make you want ice cream every day! Anyway, I love ice cream so thought I would try it. I should preface this by saying as far as SF ice cream places go, in my mind nothing beats Bi-Rite. They have everyone beat on texture, consistency, creaminess, and sweetness. 

Line wasn't bad for Memorial Day but it was also pretty overcast and cold. They have a lot of servers moving through customers which is great, and it seems like the servers don't have to move to far away from what's in front of them at their stations to serve you a variety of flavors which is smart to keep the line moving too.

I tried four different flavors (the strawberry one, freckled chocolate, chocolate brownie, and sightglass coffee with dandelion chocolate one). My wife got the coffee, I chose the chocolate brownie. Both were wayyy too sweet! Creaminess was good, consistency was good but the sweetness really over-powered and ruined it. My wife didn't finish hers. Maybe it was an off batch? Judging by the lines and the popularity I would think they'd be pretty consistent so maybe not. 

Verdict? Bi-Rite still the measuring stick to go by with ice cream in SF compared to all the old and newer contenders. My two cents.
author: A S.

description: Was there around 9 and line was outside the door and around the corner but it moves pretty fast. I might get crucified for saying this but for all the hype we heard about their ice cream, it was so so. Got the roasted strawberry tres which was good but a lot of all the other flavors I had tried samples of were just ok. Ended up getting the Apple brandy to go with it. The salted malted cookie dough tasted good but way to sweet to even probably finish a scoop. I prefer Jeni's icecream.
author: Ryan H.

description: I am a HUGE ice cream connoisseur and absolutely loved Salt & Straw. I've been trying a lot of ice cream places in SF and haven't been blown away yet but Salt & Straw definitely had unique ice cream flavors. Their seasonal flavors were Farmers Market themed and had interesting flavors such as Freckled Chocolate Zucchini Bread (pretty good!) and Carrot Cake and more. Service was extremely friendly and offered me a wide variety of samples which I really appreciated. I highly recommend the Peach Vinegar Cobbler with toasted nutmeg or the Roasted Strawberry tres leches. Honestly any flavor would've been great. There's also nice benches for seating outside and it's located in a neat town, right next to an awesome bookstore. Definitely recommend to check it out!
author: Amy T.

description: The BEST vegan ice cream and genuinely helpful staff!  They usually have roasted strawberry coconut and it's so fresh and the well balanced (coconut doesn't overpower the strawberry flavor).  PS they have a sugar cone that's vegan too!
author: Janet Y.

description: The wait sucks but the ice cream and service is really great. The strawberry tres leches is amazing. And they really let you try every flavor
author: Tina L.

description: Way way overrated. I almost tried all of the flavors and just felt they were all very heavy and buttery flavored. Some of these weird sounding flavors taste as bad as they sound. I'm not a fan at all and will never be back. I'd rather wait in line for Bi-Rite than here. The best thing was the waffle cone, but who doesn't make a good one these days. Save your time and tummy for somewhere else.
author: Ahmed H.

description: The trendy new thang from Portland. Bypass the line and get a pint. The peach cobbler was great. Olive oil lemon custard was less noticeable. Very good.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Yummm, you scream, I scream, we all scream for ICE CREAMMM~ Heard about Salt & Straw opening up in SF but wasn't sure when, was in the area and stumbled upon it on Yelp! They've been open for about a week. Line was already out the door and we got in line just before it curved around the corner. From that point until we paid and walked out with our ice creams took 40 minutes! Definitely a long wait, but well worth it for the sweet treat. Service was  nice, they took their time with each guest. If you're in line and thirsty, they also have a water dispenser by the door. Got lucky with a parking spot a few doors away from the shop, it was metered.

Boyfriend ended up getting a single scoop of the coffee. I ended up with the strawberry tres leches. It had a fat chunk of tres leches cake in it that lasted me my whole waffle cone as I ate around and into my ice cream. They have two menus, the classic stuff and a seasonal monthly menu. 

$4 kid scoop
$5 single scoop
$7 double, additional .50 cents to split it
$1.25 upcharge for a waffle cone.
author: Tina N.

description: Really good ice cream.   No weird flavors at this location but still good.   A little on the pricy side,  but its SF so outs expected.
author: Crystal L.

description: This is the BEST! Awesome selection and each bite leaves you wanting more. It is worth waiting in the perpetual line, but if you can't, there are a selection of to go pints- skip the queue and walk past it to pick one up and go straight to the cashier. Better to wait in line for the real thing though- try the strawberry tres leches or almond brittle- just SO good.
author: Chris S.

description:
My star system for this review:

Store: .5 star - plus 1 star for look and feel of the space; minus half a star for waiting more than 15 minutes in a line at an ice cream store - something I've never done anywhere I've ever eaten ice cream at before - even on a happening night with Mitchell's ice cream at the store in the mission.

Service: .5 stars - I wouldn't want to be in the shoes of the staff - so I generally feel that they handle it well and do a nice job. Unfortunately service isn't really the main thing when you're there for the ice cream.

Selection: .5 stars - plus 1 star for variety; minus half a star for inconsistency of quality between different selections.

Quality: 0 stars - look - having an overabundance of sugar or caramel or salt or whatever - is just not great in quality control. Quality reflects good balance between elements in the recipe. There appears to be a basic inconsistency here.

Taste: 0 stars - I've tasted ice cream in every major city I've visited in the US (13), several minor cities (4), a town or two (3) and 4 separate European countries. I've eaten sorbet, sherbet, ice cream, gelato in countless artisanal flavors, shaved ice, popsicles, and a variety of fried ice cream, bonbons, ice cream shakes, malts, and floats as well as a fair share of sundaes and occasionally some surprising dessert creations that aren't easy to describe. Across that plethora of desserts, I have never in my life thrown away a creamy flavorful frozen concoction sometimes called ice cream before - until now. Way too sweet even for the obsessed ice cream fan that I am. Also too salty. And the cream base - not doing it for me either. I practically chug whole milk daily - so it's not from a particular intolerance.

All I can think of to say in response to all the five star reviews is - what exactly are you eating here - because it's not what I ate. 

I had the strawberry tres leches, the salted honey marshmallow, the freckled woodblock chocolate and the honey lavender - 2 scoops each visit - 2 separate visits in July to verify that I wasn't crazy or ill.

I wanted to really like this place since I'm an adventurous tester of new tastes - but - instead I can only offer a cautionary tale of a hope gone wrong.

Perhaps a year from now the food scientists concocting these flavors will cut back on the mounds of sugar and I will have a reason to try again.

I threw in an extra half star because I didn't have a choice. I hope your experience is different from mine.
author: John-Michael S.

description:
Absolutely loved this place! My roommate told me about this place and we decided to try it out together. She was telling me about how yummy there tres leches with strawberries was, being a strawberry fan I had to try it. 

We arrived around 7:30ish? It wasn't busy but not overly packed. I assume it would be packed if it was a sunny hot day.  They give pretty big tasters which is awesome!! I tried the coffee ice cream which is also one of my all time favorites and it was very delicious. Its more on the coffee side and not very creamy. They offer a variety of sizes I chose a full scoop but split my scoop into two flavors, they do charge you $.50. 

Overall I really enjoyed the ice cream I would return but not on a sunny day because I can only imagine how crazy it would be. Its not a large place and its really more of a get your ice cream and walk around. They do have bar stools by the window to sit and eat. Reason for my 4 stars is mainly the seating area is lacking, the line system seems crazy, the counter area where you can try flavors and place your order is small. It can be very claustrophobic and it wasn't even that busy when I went. I wish the prices were a little cheaper but I do get why it's priced how it is. It is a place that people must try!
author: Veronica V.

description: Absolutely love the creativity that goes into the flavors. As a vegan, I'm always pleasantly surprised with the choices I have at Salt & Straw. The staff is always incredibly upbeat as well. Very welcoming environment!
author: Jessie S.

description: Salt and Straw is easily one of the tastiest ice cream places in SF. They have so so many flavors that you want to try when you read the descriptions and each is just fantastic. They're creamy and have very pronounced notes of what is advertised. I had the salted honey marshmallow with walnuts and the roasted strawberry with tres leches, both of which were phenomenal. There's usually a line but it moves pretty fast, and if you don't live to far you can stop in and pick up pints.
author: Kim B.

description:
Will have to try more of the flavors, but for now, it's really good but not as mind blowing as my first time at Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe. Opening day wasn't too bad with a 15 min wait at 1PM and the store manager was very friendly to all guests.

I tried the caramelized almond and the roasted strawberry tres leches. Both were thick and tasty, but not extremely unique (probably due to my choice in flavor). I went with a scoop of the strawberry which ended up being a very creamy and thick savory strawberry flavor with some strawberry puree and cake chunks inside.

Hoping to try the more interesting flavors next time around, which would very likely bump it up to a 5.
author: Jeff N.

description: as if this place needs another good review. not your average creamery, the flavors are a little wild, but they're so good! the flavors themselves are the kind  you didn't know you needed it until you've tried em. the seasonal flavors keep you coming back. also i 100% would not pay $5 for a scoop of ice cream if the staff wasn't so nice. Paige is the sweetest!
author: Carah J.

description:
While I stood in line fire nearly 30 minutes with friends in the cold fog of San Francisco, this place was totally worth the wait! The menu rotates though a couple of key flavors serve as a staple to the joint. The people serving are absolutely nice and treat you as if you are the only customer there! They definitely keep a posture of pleasant service and smiling facing not rushing you to get your order in and get out. Take your time and try as many flavors as you like and enjoy your treat! 

I am totally going back here!
author: Julius N.

description: Decided to try out this new homemade ice cream joint due to the line out the door (figured it must be good). They had multiple unique flavors and decent portion sizes. $5 for a single scoop. Overall, fun to try once.
author: Jasson C.

description: Came here on a Saturday and line was out the door! Prices are high. Very nice smell coming into the place. I got the chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream and vanilla. $5 for one scoop. Not impressed by flavor. Over hyped. Going to go with the ice cream I get from grocery store instead.
author: Bentley D.

description: Ice cream shop originally from Portland making its way to SF. Very exciting new flavors like "Birthday Cake and Blackberry" and "Sightglass Coffee and Chocolate" Ice cream and waffle cones are hand made and taste so good!
author: John N.

description: Love it. Love the flavors. I have to admit though I'm a bit of a basic bitch and get the caramel ribbons every time but fuck it. The ice cream rocks. Pricing on par with portions.
author: Abdul C.

description:
Not that tasty but pricy and very small scoops. Moreover the girl have been treating us not good. Her face was telling us: "I'm so f...in tired and I hate everybody"lol very poor service 
  I will not come back again.
author: Yana C.

description: The tempting smell of Salt & Straw can be found within at least a half block radius from the store. I loved the smell of their fresh waffle cones in the air. When my friends and I arrived Sunday evening, the line was wrapped around the store. We waited for about 30 minutes which wasn't too bad. When it was our turn, we were given the opportunity to try any and all flavors currently on the menu before making our decision. My favs of the night were the Olive Oil and Lemon and the Salted Caramel. In the end, I decided on a kids scoop in a sugar cone ($4.50ish)
author: Michelle C.

description: I love that Salt & Straw provides out of the ordinary flavors you wouldn't even think up. I love that it's different, affordable and just all around exciting to try something new there. Def. recommend:)
author: Kris C.

description: Finally! A fucking Salt & Straw close by. Whenever we go to Disneyland, my girl always wants to go out of the way just to go to the LA location. Anywho, I got the Wildflower Honey w/ Ricotta Walnut Lace Cookies, Honey Lavender, Teranga Baobab Juice & Coconut, and finally the Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches. I know, I'm a fat ass but who cares. All flavors are super good. I love how S&S always has different flavors every month. The way they also sample their flavors are nice as well. They will go to whoever is next in line, ask you what you want to sample and boom, you're good. Great environment, workers were super kind and great ice cream!
author: Maikell B.

description: I tried the peach vinegar cobbler.  One scoop on a waffle cone was way more ice cream then I expected. It is a little pricey for ice cream, but worth it
author: M G.

description: I'm a fan of the local ingredients and unique flavors. I had the seasonal "roasted strawberry tres leches" ice cream in a kids sized cone. I was excited to try Salt & Straw to see if they lived up to the hype. I'm a new fan and I can't wait for the Hayes Valley location to open. And I would love to see compost and recycling bins out as soon as possible.
author: Josie C.

description: AMAZING! DELICIOUS! UNIQUE! yes name it all! We first tried this place in Los Angeles, and we really wanted something like this here in NorCal. After a long hike in SF, we were getting our cravings for ice cream, and we just couldnt believe it! It just opened up as well a month before coming!. See a long line?!?! Who cares! it is worth it and cant get ice cream like this elsewhere. Thank you salt & straw for being the best ice cream!
author: Patrick D.

description: Absolute favorite ice cream in the world. We come all the way from Arizona just to eat this ice cream! Would highly recommend.
author: Lexie H.

description:
Thrilled to pieces that there is a San Francisco location. My first try of their ice cream was their first location in Portland. 

LOVE LOVE LOVE their peanut brittle with salted ganache flavor!!
author: Keriann H.

description:
The staff here is amazing - total icing on the cake since the ice cream here is amazing as well. The flavors may sound strange but honestly, Salt & Straw know what they are doing. The employees are all so happy and willing to let you try as many flavors until you make up your mind about what you want. What you get for your money is worth it - it's obvious the ingredients are fresh and there's a distinction between the ice cream at Salt & Straw vs. others. The ice cream is so fulfilling that we couldn't even finish what we ordered (note to self, next time we will share). There was a line out the door and we waited, it was well worth it. I would do it again, honestly. The way you're treated here makes you feel special, even with 20 people behind you in line, the experience is a really good one.

Thanks, Salt & Straw, so glad you're finally in SF.
author: Nikki R.

description:
TIP: DON'T STAND IN LINE. SKIP THE LINE AND BUY A PINT !!

This place is good. The line is actually insane, because at the end of the day it is just ice cream. The flavors are unique and it's other locations are in LA and Portland so it is just superrrr trendy.

My favorite flavor so far is the salted caramel. 

But again, don't spend an hour in line for ice cream. Just buy the darn pint, or 3. You do you, just don't wait in line.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
So you wanna know what's great & what's not so great at Salt & Straw?
Here's the "scoop":
I had never heard of Salt & Straw prior to a couple weeks ago, but there was such buzz, & I was was already around the corner from them, so I thought why not. 
What's not so great: the line. 
You can see employees working their tails off, darting to & fro, but still, there's a line, & even when it appears to be short. It isn't. More on "why" there's a line later. 
What's so great: first off, the employees. They're super happy, friendly, & professional. But mostly they're patient. Bless their hearts (as they say in the south). 
Secondly, the variety of flavors is amazing, and how brilliant of them to have "seasonal flavors" to keep the stock fresh & new.  
Third, if you don't want to deal with the line, & you can restrain yourself, you can simply go to the front of the line, grab a pint, pay & leave. 
This is a FANTASTIC business model, & many different stores can learn from them. 
The main reason there's a line is because while the employees are in fact working their butts off, customer after customer asks them for several "trials". This takes A LOT of time. The more time an employee spends with a customer, the longer each transaction takes. The longer each transaction takes, the more backed up it gets. The more back up it gets, creates a line. Lines cause curiosity & excitement.  (Which in turn, create longer lines)
They know this so well, that above the freezer, it reads, "Let's get straight to the pint...grab a pint & skip the line." (Pic posted)
There it is. Easy, right?  They know there'll be a line because they create it. If you're impatient, you grab a pint & pay more than the amount you would've paid had you just gotten just a scoop.  The person who helped me was shocked that I didn't want any trials. Because the employees aren't slacking & are super attentive & friendly, & immediately thank you for waiting, the wait seems worth it. 
Is it?
The ice cream is very good. No doubt about it. But the line thing is annoying. That's why I took one star off.  But I understand WHY they do it. People won't take more than 3-4 trials because it looks greedy, & that costs S&S nothing. Technically, they could just give those people smaller scoops, really. 
I'm not sure if I'll go back. Not only because I don't live in Pac Heights, & parking is tough around there., but mostly because of the line. 
It's too long of a wait for a scoop of ice cream. 
And it'll never change because it's their business model. And it works well. Damn well. 
So in the end, it's very good ice cream, with fantastic employees, but a stupid line that really could be changed. (if they wanted to...)
author: Reed S.

description: I love that they rotate new flavors through each month. I'm not into super sweet ice-cream, which seems to be the flavor profile of many flavors here, but there are always a few milder flavors that keep me coming back. It should be mentioned that this is a very pricey indulgence ($11 a pint?). Also, there is an obliviously moneyed vibe at the Fillmore location that makes me want to run away while waiting in line. But there are some seriously delicious and one-of-a-kind flavors here (Goat cheese with marionberries & habenero - AMAZE-BALLS!!!!) and the service is beyond excellent, so for quality and originality, 4 stars!
author: Jen H.

description: My friends from Portland always RAVE about Salt and Straw so naturally I had to wait in line opening day to see what the hype was about. Let me you Salt and Straw has some of the best ice cream I've ever had; and trust me, I've had a lot of ice cream. Everyone there was so kind, especially Annie. She allowed my brother and I to sample all the flavors we wanted and was able to answer. If you are an ice cream enthusiast like me I definitely recommended checking it out, it's for sure made it on my list of top 5 ice cream shops in SF.
author: Moh K.

description:
One of the staples from Portland has finally arrived in SF. It's known for unique flavors that's also tasty. Like the ones in Portland, the ice cream in the sf store is delicious! 

I tried the almond brittle and salted ganache, along with honey marshmallow and walnuts on a waffle cone. The almond brittle is my go to. It's simply delicious. 

The honey marshmallow and walnuts shot to the top of my favorites list. It was not overly sweet and flavors were just right. 

I definitely would come again to try all the various flavors.
author: Keith L.

description:
This place has been hyped up a bit, and it was good, but not worth the money to me. I had the gooey brownie ice cream. It was very good, but too expensive. The line was out the door and they give free samples which is nice. 

I love ice cream, I would eat it every day if health allowed for it. I love chocolate and those types of sweets, and this place only had a few of those types of ice creams. It is geared much more towards fruity types of flavors which limited my options. So, I will not knock this place for having flavors I don't like. If you like that type of stuff, by all means go here and try those flavors. Just not for me.
author: Stephen W.

description: Wonderful ice cream with a variety of wild, high class flavors. Most of them hit the nail on the head, a select few will disappoint. Brave the line and try something new!
author: Justin J.

description: Love love LOVE this place! First tried it in Portland- and was thrilled to know they opened their SF location. Tried this place out with some friends, the wait was not long at all, our server was the sweetest person ever and the flavors of ice cream that we all tried was absolutely insane. I got the woodblock chocolate and tried many of the other diverse flavors that they had and will definitely have to be back for more!
author: Ellen M.

description:
Perfect Ice cream ;^)  The flavors are amazing;  try as many of them as you want before ordering.  My advice:  try all of the flavors that have at least one flavor that you will like.  Even if it has something a bit odd/different, you'll probably love it!

My new favorite flavor:  'Peach, Vinegar cobler, with Nutmeg'.  It's amaziing!

If you're ever near Pacific Heights, I recommend that you go there -- any time of day.  Expect a long line, but it moves pretty quickly -- until you get there and try all of the flavors!  Fortunately they let you start tasting when you're in line.
author: Brian A.

description:
This creamery is definitely on the pricier side, though their portion sizes make up for it. I got the a double scoop Rhubarb crumble and roasted strawberry tres leches. Both were pretty solid with the right amount of sweetness and creamy texture in each. 

The line wrapped around the corner of the store, but the line moves pretty fast since there are a lot of people working on the same shift. I do recommend trying this place out since they offer a unique variety of flavors!
author: Charisse S.

description: The ice cream is 5 stars for sure but twice I've had pretty shitty 1 star worthy experiences. 1st offense: a girl gave me my single scoop on a waffle cone and when I went to check out the guy at the register started getting onto her because the scoop was too large. They literally made me give it back so she could redo it. Seriously?? It's $6, let me have the 2 extra bites. Plus, you just threw out perfectly good ice cream!! 2nd offense (yesterday) my husband and I went in and each got a single scoop on a waffle cone and I took one lick and the scoop nearly rolled off. Normally the cone is filled with ice cream and this guy just put a small scoop resting on top of the dry cone. You can keep your plain ice cream less dry waffle cone... guess I'll just stick to a cup if I go back ‍
author: Kristal G.

description: Besides going to Salt and Straw for the amazing flavors, the employees are worth it too! Paige was so helpful and bubbly, she really made our first trip there a great one!
author: Miranda H.

description:
Good variety of flavors and I love that you can try them all before you decide. There are a number of seasonal and classic flavors so you can always look forward to a new set of flavors when you visit. Service is definitely faster than Smitten but we had to wait 20 mins in line (6 pm on a weekday). 
I knocked off a star because the server (although pleasant) gave me the wrong flavor combo in my 2 scoop cup :(
author: Amana K.

description:
I've stood in line here for close to an hour, and have no regrets. The ice cream is SO good that it makes up for the long wait times. Their flavors are really innovative and surprising and, with their monthly flavors changing regularly, it really keeps you coming back for more. 

The smell of fresh waffle cones is emitted to the outside so customers that are waiting in like can be tantalized by that smell and will be less likely to leave the line. 

The customer service has been consistently great. All of the employees are really patient with customers who want to try a bunch of different flavors, which is really nice to see. 

Some of my favorite flavors have been the freckled woodblock chocolate, double fold vanilla, strawberry tres leches, and lastly, fresh cheese and strawberries (one of their July special flavors).
author: Natalie Q.

description:
The ice cream was good. Not the best but not the worst I've ever had. But the 3/5 starts also takes into account the unsanitary conditions I observed there. Employees were making and handling waffles cones as well as regular cones with their bare hands. I observed someone coming on their shift and jumping right in line to take someone's order  

When it was time for me to order, the girl grabbed the waffle cone by the top with her bare hands and then proceeded to grab a napkin with hold the bottom of the cone while she scooped the ice cream. What kind of nonsense is that? She might as well have pre-licked the rim of the waffle cone for me at that point. I opted out and got a cup instead after seeing that. 

I had the double fold vanilla ice cream. Needless to say it tasted and had the consistency of store bought ice cream. The ice cream wasn't creamy, and tasted bland. 

I had high expectations for this place, but people need to start observing what's happening behind the count. PLEASE WEAR GLOVES WHEN HANDING PEOPLES FOOD.
author: Butimnotayelper D.

description:
Salt in Ice cream ?? Are we confused of what we want? Hell yeah !! Salted ice cream. It is a great concept and won't fail to impress ice cream lovers, who want to try out something new. The concept originated in the state of Oregan. Soo.. there is a fixed menu and there is the one which changes every month. 
The fixed menu has some great novelties!! I adore their Brittle almond with salted ganache!! It's Soo popular that it is unavailable at times. Other flavors like Roasted strawberry Tres leche, olive oil with lemon and Dandalian chocolate is great too !!!

For the monthly menu - they do great mixes !!
July is the month of berries and they will have all berry ice creams !!! I tried their flavours for the month of May and June too!!
Eagerly waiting for August.
Also also ... There is a huge line outside so many times. Like a 20-30 min wait. Be prepared to stand outside even though its that day when there is wind blowing all over!! This is also because you get to try as many flavors as you want before you decide your best one. I have been here a lot and I always meet tourists who are excited to try this place out. Ofc many locals too !!
author: Foram C.

description: Tried it for the first time and pretty good! Interesting and unique flavors with a touch of sea salt sweetness!
author: Jen L.

description: S&S certainly know ice cream. Rich and creamy products with flavorful combinations and textures. They will keep feeding you samples with metal mini-spoons, if that is your pleasure, but I don't recommend this if there's a line behind you ;) At the urging of an ice cream fanatic, I visited S&S one week after the SF grand opening. Sampled many flavors and left with good, ol' strawberry (roasted strawberry tres leches) and chocolate (freckled Woodblock chocolate) in a waffle cone. Server took pity on me because of tire trouble from the Nimitz and comped me my cone, which I gave as his tip. The company  must have a policy that emphasizes customer service, cos the servers do more than just scoop and shoo, they shmooze. It must be exhausting. I do enjoy the vibe and the products. Will come back again but maybe at their future location in Hayes Valley.
author: Landlubber L.

description:
Chocolate flavor is great - not too sweet 
And my advice: don't get a pint as mine was gone bad already when I opened it for first time at home
author: G E.

description:
Tried this for the first time and it was amazing! Tried about 4 different types and each one kept getting better and better. The favors are rich and intense. However wish the consistency was a little thicker, depending on the flavor the ice cream would be too gooey.
Slightly hipster vibe, it's a cute little shop. Would definitely go back again.
author: Rosy C.

description: Best ice cream in town! I would absolutely recommend this gem and try this place out.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is worth all the hype! They change their flavors every month & you can sample as many flavors as you want before deciding which one (or two) to choose from. 

P.S the scoops are HUGE
author: Naz M.

description:
BEST DAY EVER! Came in 10:58pm and definitely worth our wait.  Waiting for a 20min line, after our our late grab of Phillysteak sandwich from BUSTERS. And we run for an ice cream! 

Andi was so nice and pleasant with a welcoming smile. 

Flavors are awesome. Tried some few flavors but the Seq Salt and the Sightglass were definitely gave me the best smile when I tasted it. Got one scoop each!

Definitely must come back and bring some of my friends and loved ones!
author: Jeyem V.

description: Was in the line for over an hour on their opening day and it was well worth the wait. their ice cream is really good and fresh. they can use some more seating but i guess usually people take the ice cream to go. Must get the flight if you cant decided on what you want to get. They also let you try samples if you want to explore. Very friendly and helpful staff.
author: Jan H.

description:
Waited 1 hour to try this new entry into our already awesome ice cream scene. With all the hype and long lines, if you're going to wait an hour just get the tasting plate ($11.50 for 4 flavors). 

Compared to other ice cream shops, their flavors have the staples of chocolate, vanilla, and coffee, but overall seem to skew towards floral and fruity flavors. I got the tasting with;
-Olive oil w/ lemon custard: I fell in love with olive oil ice cream from Humphrey Slocombre, but this version is tasty! The olive oil imparts a smooth buttery texture with the flavor in the aftertaste that is well complimented by the lemon custard, which isn't overly tart.
-Double Fold Vanilla: Solid vanilla, safe option, but was expecting more oomph.
-Rhubarb Crumble w/ Toast Anise: Probably my favorite flavor, very reminiscent of an ala mode/pie with a jammy/fruity rhubarb and hints of licorice from the anise.
-Wildflower Honey w/ Ricotta Walnut lace cookies: Deep honey flavor with added depth from the ricotta giving it some body. The walnut cookies add a great texture without adding extra sweetness.

Also tried my friends sightglass coffee with cacao nibs: Smooth coffee with depth of flavor accentuated with cacao nibs. Definitely a favorite coffee flavor.
author: Chad S.

description: Worth the wait, worth the calories, worth the memories. Service is outstanding with lovely people to help sample you out before you order! I had the peach vinegar cobbler with toasted nutmeg, and salted honey marshmallow & walnut. Divine. If you're into novelty, one-of-a-king and unique twists on heavily flavored ice cream treats...don't skip Salt & Straw!
author: Annalise B.

description: I'm not ashamed to say that I look forward to trying all the new flavors of the month! My co-workers and I are always surprised that the employees are always willing to let us sample all the new flavors . Their ice cream is definitely worth the wait. Salt & Straw's eclectic and delicious monthly ice cream flavor combinations never fail to delight or intrigue our tastebuds! This also extends to their classic flavors, some of my favorites are the roasted strawberry coconut, honey lavender, and olive oil & lemon custard
author: Brian L.

description: The best ice cream I've ever eaten! I miss the strawberry cheesecake they had a few months ago. Please bring it back!
author: Aimée I.

description: Love love love the creativeness of Salt & Straw.  It's a dangerously tasty ice cream shop. Expect a line and a short wait, because they really cater to each guest.
author: Linda K.

description: Hot Damn. Everything that nite was just outstanding. We have repeated many times - sorry just did not "check in"
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
Just as amazing as Portland, the most magical ice cream store that treats everyone like the kid they are at heart. Encourages you to try every flavor and come back for the monthly updates. 

Pro tip: finishing salt on the sight glass coffee ice cream :)
author: Bessy L.

description: I don't think this place lives up to the hype. The ice cream is average, but there always seems to be a long line for this place. It's good to try to see what the buzz is about, but I probably will not becoming back here.
author: Angelia U.

description:
Not sure what happened the night in question. I was meeting friends at the Kabuki theater so I decided to walk over and enjoy some ice cream before the show. The line was long, so employees asked people in line if they wanted any samples. I declined 3 or 4 times because I already had my mind made up on the flavors. One employee asked me multiple times. What happened next was upsetting. This same employee, who checked with me multiple times,  decided to bypass my place in line and asked the group of white people behind me if they wanted to be helped with their orders. He walked them over and opened up a register. Not wanting to make a scene I shook my head and kept moving forward. The second employee, who was helping the couple in front of me, looked at me and didn't say anything. I smiled at her, but she started to walk away from the counter, so I expected to be helped by someone else. She then asked the group behind me for their orders. At this point I was too upset not to say anything. 
Depending on who is reading this, you may or may not understand what this feels like when you are willing to spend your hard earned money but feel discriminated against. I hope this wasn't the case and just an error by both employees.
author: Charlie S.

description: Long lines, long wait, expensive (minimum 5 dollars). All the ice cream tastes like salt which is the point but it isn't enjoyable. Save money and pour out some salt packets in an average pint. Also no seating nor is there a smart area to walk. Parking is ok.
author: Emily L.

description: I've eaten about 3000 calories of San Francisco ice cream in the past couple days and this was my favorite. I tried the strawberry and the caramel based upon the server's recommendation. The caramel was solid and the strawberry was literally the best I've ever had. I would normally never order strawberry but the flavor and consistency were 10/10. The servings were also huge. A double is big enough for a family.
author: Ryan D.

description: Oh my god. Ice cream is already good but this is the craziest good ice cream since smitten came to town.
author: Chazz D.

description: Fabulous but expensive-stop at the ATM before you go in. Delicious flavors, fun service providers but not much place to sit and enjoy. It's crowded and it's definitely not a lingering kind of place. Get your scoop, wolf it down and out you go. Wish it was a little more relaxed and had more comfy seating
author: Sandy M.

description: HOT DAMN the ice cream here is good. I'm probably not the best reviewer for this joint because I've only gotten one flavor and I haven't been able to bring myself to try something different. The Olive Oil & Lemon Custard is just absolutely amazing. It's so decadent that it will make you feel like a Greek goddess. It's super creamy with just the right amount of tart. It's worth the wait.
author: Yuxuan N.

description:
Delicious! A welcomed addition to this neighborhood filling the empty Evolution Fresh space. With the smell of the delicious, buttery, crunchy waffle cone wafting out into the streets, Salt & Straw is THE new ice cream stop in SF. 
The lines were manageable early on during the day but definitely became long after 6pm. Plan accordingly as this hot new place has everyone queuing up potentially an hour long. Once you are in, you are welcomed by very friendly staff willing to help you find the flavor of your choice. I tried almost every flavor and they were all well balanced and I'm sure there will be something to please everyone.
author: Jenny W.

description:
While I was visiting LA earlier this year, my friend who lives suggested that I go to Salt &a Straw ("It's a LA must eat"). She was right. And I was so impressed with both the customer service and the ice cream that I went there multiple times during my stay in LA.

Upon returning to the Bay and learning that we just recently got a Salt & Straw, I was so excited! The first time I went to the location in San Francisco, my friends and I were helped by Xander, who was exceptionally friendly and had a great positive vibe. And of course, the ice cream was delicious. 

Since then, I have driven into SF from Marin just for the ice cream countless times. I've introduced a bunch of friends to the place and they love it as well! 

Try the Honey Lavender with sea salt sprinkles. I wouldn't, however, spend extra on the waffle cone (it's ok).
author: Hafsa B.

description: There's a reason there is a line for this stuff, it's the dairy equivalent of crack cocaine, but you can feel good about the obscene amounts of sugar you are slurping down your fat gullet because hey all the ingredients are locally sourced and organic. I'm pretty sure they pump the smell of their waffle cones into the outside air kind of like Subway does with their bread. My suggestion is to not bother with the line and just get a to-go pint and a spoon. Fatty.
author: David K.

description: Great location on Filmore! Dropped in here after grabbing a bite at Rooster and Rice down the street. Not a lot of parking so might want to take the bus. Totally walkable from California street if you take the muni 1. Make sure to sample, they're generous with their sample scoops!
author: Joshua M.

description: Just a quick get-by place where my family and I got ice cream. Mine was the a single scoop of a chocolate brownie ice cream. It was good at least.
author: Joshua L.

description: Very poor customer service. Stood in empty line for 4 min while one staff helped couple pick flavors and 2 other staff totally ignored me. Very unhappy.
author: Perry L.

description: I originally went to the one in Portland. The vibe is a little different at this location but the ice cream is just as good. Be prepared to wait in line, but the line is worth it!
author: H. A.

description: Oh good gawd. This place is goooood. Like better than B&J's good. Yeah uh huh. Bring your jacket and some comfy shoes because the line is out the door, but so worth the wait. INSIDER TIP: You can cut the line if you buy a pint!
author: Jenny C.

description: Worth the wait. The best ice cream on planet earth.
author: Ryan P.

description: There was a long line even late at night, which I thought was a good sign. I appreciated the fact that they had 3 different vegan flavors (although roasted strawberry coconut was no longer available when I visited), because most ice cream stores I have been to so far carried only 1 or 2 vegan flavors if any. They have a very extensive list of flavors for non-vegan ice cream as well that all sounded very tasty! I had their peach crumble bar vegan ice cream and thought the texture of the ice cream was quite interesting. It wasn't really creamy but kind of spongy. Regardless, it was a good experience with friendly staff and the sweet ice cream.
author: Bella Z.

description:
Many different flavors and great ice cream. This time I tried the Old Fashion Dad's Float in root beer.

Be patient as each customer is given the opportunity to decide what they want. Since many are experiencing the treat for the first time, it is not unusual to taste a couple or three flavors before making up their mind!
author: R G.

description: Hands down the best ice cream in the country. Anytime we are within an hour of SF or LA we go out of our way to make it here. The high price is worth it. I once bought a cooler and dry ice to drive some home. On the way my car broke down and I was roadside in the middle of the desert for 3.5 hours in the middle of the night. Worst road trip of my life but the ice cream made it all worth it.
author: Sam J.

description: I can't tell you what they did but it truly renewed my faith in humanity.   Unbelievable act of random kindness and I can't believe it.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
author: Patty H.

description: I love love love Salt and Straw!  Ever since I went to Portland I was hooked and was waiting for it to open up here in SF.  I went opening weekend and waited for 1.5 hours and yes that was crazy, but I had good company.  I love the flavors and always look forward to the new flavors each month.  I have been back often and this is definitely a regular spot for me if I want ice cream.  I used to love going to Humphrey Slocumbe and Mitchell's but have not been to either since Salt and Straw finally opened here.
author: M. T.

description: Deserving of every single star. This place is awesome and just as good as the one in Portland! Friendly staff too.
author: Holly M.

description: One of my absolute favorite ice cream places! The staff is very friendly and very helpful. The line tends to be long around dessert time but moves rather fast. I would recommend trying the Strawberry Tres Leche ice cream. Also, if you cannot decide on one flavor, get a split scoop which is two flavors but the size of one scoop.
author: Mary M.

description: I love this ice cream so much, it's really amazing with unique flavors, local ingredients, and generous testings.  The lines can be long but if you know what you want, you can pick up a pint from the freezer and head straight to the cashier.
author: Merritt M.

description: My new favorite ice cream place! Inventive flavors, quality ingredients, great experience!
author: Janie S.

description: Yum! the ice cream scooper was so welcoming, it was a great experience. He explained the different flavors and let us try a bunch. While we stayed with tried and true flavors it was a fun experience and just down the street from one of our favorite parks too. Wonderful neighborhood to just walk around. YUMMY!
author: Sarah A.

description: HAIR IN ICECREAM. I was overjoyed when I found this place after I took my dog to the vet  (which is up the road from here) tried honey lavender the first time and it was amazing. Had been dying to come back. I ordered some ice cream for a friend last night. We were eating it together and he had a hair in his ice cream after I had been raving on about this place. The hair had not freshly fallen in, but was deeply embedded inside the ice cream. We lost our appetite and I felt kindof bad because we drove here just to get ice cream. I had also bought a whole pint for a dinner party tonight but won't be bringing it as I'll be really embarrassed if there's another hair incident.
author: E B.

description: Only downside to this place is the wait and the slightly expensive prices. Other than that, the ice cream is delicious. I had the honey lavender and it was amazing. To be fair, they do give generous scoops too. Definitely coming back!
author: Vicky O.

description: GREAT ice cream and amazing customer service. It is a little expensive, but it's worth it. The scoops are good sized and the ice cream is amazing. I love the honey lavender, and I also loved the dracula's blood pudding (limited time only). There's usually a line but it moves fast, they also offer you samples in line!
author: Courtney A.

description:
I went there to try their 2 vegan flavors since I don't eat cow dairies and they sounded really good. 
The strawberry-coriander sorbet tasted only like strawberries, not a hint of coriander. Also, the texture was kinda meh.
The Teranga Baobab Juice & Coconut was nothing special, I could only taste the acidity of the baobab - which I usually like but paired with some more intense ingredients than young coconut (or coconut water maybe?). 
The vegan cone was delicious btw.
It's also really expensive.
I'll never go back there.
I give 2 stars only because I have no experience with the non-vegan flavors, so I hope they're better.
author: Valentina G.

description: Best ice cream around!! As many samples as you want... employees are soooooo warm and welcoming! They don't rush you, no matter how many people are behind you in line (and 90% of the time there is a line) Alexis is THE MAN!!! He is so knowledgeable and friendly. Hope for many years of success for this company!
author: KC P.

description: Great customer service. Try all flavors the staff recommends it. Love the dirty spoon chute! Kind of pricey of course but delicious ice cream. Love the Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches! They also have a vegan flavor!
author: R P.

description: Tried the terranga baobab juice & coconut
author: Vivian W.

description: I love all the wacky but delicious flavors. My favorite after a long day full of meeting is the honey lavender. Stop by and give it a try you'll be hooked.
author: Victoria R.

description: Just came back for the Thanksgiving flavors! They are fantastic and I wish I could try all. I recommend the persimmon stuffing flavor, but turkey was interesting too (apparently its more like salted caramel than anything). Lavender and olive oil are also top of my list
author: Alex L.

description: It's definitely not worth the insane 30-40 minute ordeal. It's good but not the best ice cream out there. I actually prefer McConnell's!
author: Mira N.

description:
We haven't tried the ice cream yet but can't say enough about one employee in particular! We were buying ice cream today for my stepdad who is in the ICU at Sutter Hospital and when the employee asked what it was it for and we told him, he said the ice cream was on the house. Little acts of kindness like that go SO far and are so appreciated. It helped turn my mom's crappy day around and put a huge smile on our faces. THANK YOU, we never got your name but THANK YOU.

Update: Danny LOVES the chocolate gooey brownie ice cream!! We'll be back for much more in the next few days!
author: Kellia S.

description: I love a lot about Salt and Straw. I love the decor, how nice the people who work here are, how great all the flavors are. I just don't like how I can never choose which flavor to get because they're all so good. It's a good thing they give you so many samples to help (or maybe not really help) with the decision making process. The line may get long, but they're pretty efficient at getting through it. I would most definitely recommend this place.
author: k h.

description: Why would a place like this use CARAGEENAN in their product? If you are charging over $10 a pint you can afford to use better ingredients. Give your head a shake for taking advantage of consumer trust. Sure - people might expect to increase their chances of diabetes with ice cream, but chronic inflammation caused by CARAGEENAN is seen as a root cause of Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and cancer... as well as increased glucose intolerance and impaired insulin action.
author: Mike G.

description: Not my favorite ice cream. I feel its a little bit heavy after you eat it. Good variety of flavors but that's all. In my opinion this place is overrated.
author: Bruna B.

description: Their ice cream is absolutely delicious! Is it worth waiting in a line that wraps around the building? Not in my opinion. If you can find a time when the line isn't too bad then it is definitely worth it! I love that they have an option to try a flight of ice creams
author: Corinne K.

description: I've been to the locations in both Portland and LA, so S&S in SF is a real treat. I enjoy the seasonal selections and the fact that they stay open later than most places in the city. The line is usually long, but it's great for catching up with friends and people-watching in Pac Heights.
author: Chelsea R.

description: Made the mistake of ordering a pint to skip the line. The Great Candycopia was way too salty.
author: Masaru F.

description:
Delicious! Worth every penny and second in line! Trendy little shop and a great dessert stop!

We walked in and were greeted by our ice cream guide, who described all of the flavors, the seasonal specials and shop favorites.  She answered questions about gluten free flavors knowledgeably. When some places say "you can try them all," they don't really mean it... but this place did!  We each sampled a bunch.  I went with the honey lavender and olive oil & lemon custard.  The flavors went together well and were both relaxing, like eating a spa!  

Highly recommend a visit - and I look forward to checking out the Portland shop one day!
author: Michelle S.

description: There is always a line here but trust me, it's worth the WAIT! You can try every flavor if you'd like to, the staff are super friendly, they do their best to be as fast as possible to serve the next customer, it's always so clean and well kept while everyone in line is just so HAPPY! This place is a must for people who are visiting from out of town!
author: Mari B.

description: There is yummy ice cream to be found at Salt and Straw. When I visited, the line for buying ice cream flights was around the block, but a nice lady taught me a secret: if you are buying only pints, you can skip the line! So I did.  I tried the sea salt caramel flavor, which was delicious.  I would go back in a second for seconds, too! ;)
author: Brent S.

description: Got lucky and got on a fairly short line (weekend lines look insane!) and had a great server who let us try various flavors.  We really enjoyed the curated flavors they offered and maaaaaybe made pigs of ourselves (it's allowed, vacation).
