Go here on a weekday and if you get "magic" timing you won't have to wait too long (full confession: after we left, the line was snaking out the door).  It is worth the wait though.
author: Tom T.

description: Similar to most other ice cream spots. I don't know that the line is warranted but the ice cream was good. Generous serves, but would rather save my money and go to bi-rite ice creamery.
author: Rosa K.

description: Not had many but had one small kids cup of strawberry, chocoloate. I would not call it the best ever so not sure about the hype.. just another normal mom-pop style creamery if you are driving by.
author: Sid K.

description: Our new favorite ice cream. Interesting flavors, not too creamy, not overly sweet, and open until 11pm! Not sure it's worth waiting in the often really long line, but it's definitely worth eating regardless. They have a good quick system of getting people through the line, offering generously sized tasting portions. We are partial to the split scoop, two flavors in place of one, for a small extra cost. Their portions are pretty big, so nice to have more than one flavor if you're getting a smaller size.
author: Bruce C.

description: I thought it was overrated. For the length of time we spent waiting to get in, I expected much more. Had the salted Carmel and thought it was both too salty and too sweet; had the gooey brownie and I felt like it tasted weird. I was expecting a brownie consistent with Ben and Jerry's but this one didn't do it for me. There are so many delicious icecreameries in SF that I'm not sure I'll be back.
author: L. W.

description: They have some very interesting flavor combinations which work well together although I find their recipe much sweeter than most places. Also the consistency isn't smooth as there are bits of ice crystals in every bite.
author: George C.

description: This place is okay.  I went to the one in portland oregon and got a cool shirt from there.  The flavors were kind of the same as the one in portland although they do have these seasonal flavors and a monthly menu that changes.  the cone was pretty good but i feel like some of their flavors were a bit too sweet.
author: Ben Z.

description: Bought a scoop just now but I think they want me to eat the cone first before the ice cream . Was in line for at least 45 minutes and paid $5.75 for my puny ice cream
author: Berny D.

description: Quite a new ice cream experience. Different ingredients constantly bring up surprises for the tasting buds.
author: Y C.

description: Better than Bi-Rite. Their take on salted caramel is just better. They had a bone marrow and cherry gala or which was interesting too. Second best was their almond brittle and ganache.
author: William A.

description:
I had Salt & Straw for the first time in Portland many years ago, and it was so amazing, became my favorite ice cream place. When I heard they were opening up a spot in SF, I was so excited. 

Finally made it here today, and the ice cream was as good as I remembered. The space is great and cute. The location is right on the corner, and the wait really wasn't that long. The line ended at the end of the corner, appeared to be a long wait, but it queued pretty fast. I think it was only 10-15 minutes. Staff was super nice.
author: Jenny L.

description: Literally amazing. Flavors burst from every bite in new ways. My dad is 60 and been eating strawberry ice cream for probably 59 years and said this was by far the best. Expect to pay like 7-9 bucks for two scoops, but worth it. Love the way they use Imperfect Produce and are seasonal flavors.
author: Caitlin R.

description: Really freaking good ice cream with really freaking long lines. Do yourself a favor and skip the line, buy a pint and fresh cones, and go home and enjoy some of the best ice cream around. Then, make an appointment with your personal finance advisor to figure out how the hell you're going to pay for this ice cream over and over again without cutting into your retirement fund.
author: Marcos M.

description: The service here is awesome and they give you any sample you want. The shop itself is very cute too. unfortunately I just don't like the ice cream very much. The actual cream itself seems kind of bland and they rely on mixing stuff in to give it flavor. We got the tasting menu and it was true for all four flavors. Hard to tell the honey marshmallow from the strawberry.
author: Mary S.

description: Oh my god oh my god oh my god!!! This is the best ice cream that I've ever had!!!! Every time I come to San Francisco I must come here! The service is amazing and I just cannot have enough of their ice cream... so creamy and yummy!
author: Ranim T.

description: Wow! Just Wow! I cannot begin to describe how good the flavors here are. And they let you test before you buy, which is so good! Definitely recommended.
author: Samantha C.

description: Monday afternoon, no line. Purchased two flavors. The Olive Oil Lemon Custard was delicious. The coffee flavor tasted more like hazelnut. I'll be trying this place again to see if it truly lives up to the hype. At the moment I can think of at least three places that serve better ice cream.
author: Diana B.

description:
Heavenly? Not quite. Orgasmic? Nailed it. They let you try all the flavors and they ALL are delicious. Recommend the seasonal flavors! (at least try them!)

FAIR WARNING: The line is commonly wrapped around the block. 

Pro tip: skip the line and buy a pint! You won't have any the trouble eating it all.
author: Austin H.

description:
I've been to the salt and straw in portland, los Angeles and I'm so happy to finally be able to say.... SF. I'm a huge fan of lavender ice cream and even a bigger fan of theirs! I like that they have changing monthly flavors and also classic ones.  
I noticed their classics menu varies slightly between locations (kinda bummed about)
They do have kid sized scoops that I appreciate due to the fact that I'm petite and will try to taste as many flavors as possible. (Doesn't help that they have SO. MANY. FLAVORS. Oink.)
Anyway I loved the wildflower honey with caramelized walnuts! Im normally not a fan of sorbets but this flavor is gold. Its not over the top floral-y and the walnuts give it good texture. The flavor gave off a hint of lychee. Yummm! Its a limited time monthly flavor so don't miss out.
author: B S.

description: This place is love. It is quality. It is delicious, sweet serenity. The lady behind the counter was making fresh waffle cones, and they looked so perfect and crisp I knew right away I was getting one. I was in the mood for something a little lighter, so I got a scoop of double vanilla and strawberry tres leches, and boyfriend got the marrion berry and brittle almond with chocolate ganache flavor. The complexity in each flavor was insane, the strawberry tres leches had such a fresh and pure strawberry flavor, with puree and chunks of moist, fresh cake in every bite. My vanilla was refreshing, just sweet enough but so crisp in pure vanilla flavor. My boyfriends was the knock out, and I'm not surprised. The brittle almond flavor with chunks of chocolate ganache was such a perfect melody. Yes it was pretty sweet, but the brittle chunks were soft, the almonds were pretty tender as well, with a slight bite. The chocolate ganache chunks balanced the brittle with a welcoming bitterness. The balance made me swoon, and I grabbed the cone out of his hand to taste the lemon marrion berry. The flavor had the BEST lemon flavor out of any lemon ice cream I've ever had. It wasn't overwhelming or artificial at all, just perfect, lightly sweet with a tart finish. The marrion berry puree had a fruity and strong berry flavor to compliment the light crisp lemon. This was hands down one of the best ice cream experiences I had ever had as an adult. And no, I'm not done! THE WAFFLE CONE. It was the FRESHEST waffle cone I've ever had in my life. Most waffle cones are pre-made, too thick, and slightly stale. NOT here. The cone here was so perfectly crispy, light yet sturdy enough, and had the most incredible barely sweet/hint of vanilla flavor I've never experienced before from a cone. Plus the cone complimented each scoop, and I made sure to get a crunchy bite while enjoying my cone. This place is quite extraordinary, and I couldn't recommend highly enough. If someone is giving this place bad reviews, it's because they are miserable people. Do yourself a favor and come here.
author: Raquel A.

description: Expect the line to be insanely long!! Ain't nobody got time fo dat! I skipped all the line by going inside for a prepacked pint. I've tried one flavor here before, some weird name that has too many ingredients so I can't remember what it was. Not good. Decided to give it another try since my bf kept hyping it up. We got another flavor with a similar long name of many ingredients. Still not good. Not good. If he really wants to get anywhere, he shoulda got me a prepacked pint of Three Twins Lemon Coookie $3.75.
author: Steph W.

description: I fell in love with this place. The roasted strawberry tres leches cake was amazing and as a Mexican American I 100% endorse this flavor. The seasonal flavors are a must try, we tried the bone marrow and cherry's and the honey cali rocky road. Both were great and I recommend you buy a pint, you will want more.
author: Eliott G.

description: Unique flavors - had the coffee and dandelion chocolate. It was really rich. There are some really funky flavors on the menu and I'm afraid I'm really not that adventurous! But overall a decent ice cream shop!
author: Jules M.

description: Love everything about this ice cream shop -- the company focus on local ingredients and small footprint, the delicious IC with inventive flavors, the ssssssooo nice and patient staff -- truly all good. My favorites are the Roxie (made with leftover popcorn from the Mission art theater Roxie!) and stout + chocolate was just jaw dropping great.
author: Kate A.

description: Salt & Straw boasts handmade, delicious ice cream of a variety of unique flavors. We were invited to "tastes" several flavors before making our selections which added to the fun. I thought the Peach Vinegar Cobbler was delicious and I wish I had ordered it. I ordered a Chocolate Brick type flavor (can't remember the exact name) that I didn't like as well after I got started with it. It's definitely worth the trip and the wait, but be careful to choose a flavor that you really do enjoy!
author: Marianne E.

description: Born and raised in the city and honestly I am biased that Michelle's was the best in the city but after my visit to salt and straw I've given that a second thought lol definitely loved it my girlfriend said she had it in Oregon and when they opened one here she was ecstatic! Definitely a good choice great location good environment loved it!!
author: Joshua M.

description: Meh. I mean, if you love long lines, weird flavors, and overpriced ice cream, go for it.
author: Samantha S.

description: Ordered the seasonal berry flavor, vanilla and salted caramel.  I honestly thought it was good, but IMO not noticeably better than Smitten, or Birite Creamery.  I might even like those better and they don't have a long line.  Not really sure how they justify the long line based on my experience there.  It's definitely tasty ice cream though
author: Nicolas G.

description: I have never had ice cream like this! The flavors are so unique and they taste so good! After sampling almost every ice cream on the menu I finally decided on the sea salt with caramel on a waffle cone. It was delicious! I'll defiantly be back!
author: Brittay A.

description: I feel like I expected a lot more from all the hype I had heard about S&S. Was good, but nothing standout, and definitely not worth the prices. I enjoyed the olive oil & lemon flavor, but all the others I have tried so far haven't been as mind-blowing as I've heard.
author: Meg B.

description: First off, the staff is very friendly and well-versed on all the exotic ice cream mixations they offer. The quality of the ice cream, itself, along with the premium ingredients, from lavender-honey vanilla to (my favorite) Coffee w Dandelion Dark chocolate was impressive. The Hayes Valley location was inviting, clean and well lit. Delicious smells of hot-baked cones wafting in the air wasn't half bad either. They also sell related items that are cute and pints ready to go in the tall glass doors side freezer cases. The only thing that seemed out of sync was the wallpaper. When I stepped back, I realized it's a large blow up a waffle cone pattern, but looks beige, drab and sort of 70s Holiday Inn. Also, the wood floor clashed with the wood veneer on ice cream dipping cabinets. Kinda hokey. The most important thing is the ice cream is amazing. And they are quite patient and generous with allowing you try any flavor you like before ordering (which relieves stress of possibly ordering something you didn't quite have in mind).
author: Kelly H.

description: I love the flavors, I got bone marrow, pretty crazy but yummy! I had my pup with me that night and they let her wait in line with me :D very friendly people
author: Karen M.

description: My favorite ice cream place ever .. love the flavors plus super friendly service. If u never been to salt $ straw ur missing out big time. If it's ur first time u should try the olive oil/ lemon custard and peach vinegar flavor u will be amazed
author: Mai D.

description: I havent been to the other Salt and Straws so I have nothing to compare it to. But I am a pretty picky ice cream eater. The line was long but went by pretty quickly. It was out the door and around the corner. Their service is excellent! When its your turn, they have a worker who explains the process to you if youre a first timer and they allow you to have endless samples. I say endless because I went in a group of 3 and we all had multiple samples. They were patient and kind. I tried the banana fosters, the strawberry, and the honey lavender. The bananas foster had a weird after taste for me and the strawberry has strawberry jam in it that makes it a little too sweet for my taste buds. I honestly didnt think i'd like the honey lavender but OMG it was delicious. I got a kids scoop in a waffle cone. Usually the kinds scoop comes in a sugar cone but their waffle cones are so yummy. Smells so fresh (if that makes any sense at all). The kinds scoop is smaller than the single scoop which was perfect since we came here after a huge filling dinner. Only sucky thing is that they dont have a bathroom but thats besides the point lol since were all here for the ice cream anyways!
author: Mariel Ashley S.

description: There was so much hype around this place that I was SO delighted to wait in line even though it was 40 mins. The roasted strawberry is such a delicious flavour I would definitely recommend. If you're a fan of ice cream these flavours are so unique - plus there are gluten-free options aswell so all round great spot for a Sunday stroll on Fillmore
author: Holly M.

description: Best darn ice cream hands down!!!! So addicted , I can never eat ice cream from any other place ... try the goat cheese, marionberry habaneroIce cream  ... your mouth will love you for it!!!  Lol
author: Sh J.

description: We finally decided to try out the famous salt & straw. There was a small line forming already at 3pm. Parking is a little difficult there. I tried out their three most popular flavors which was the honey lavender, strawberry thres leches, and peach cobbler. I'm usually not a fan of lavender but surprisingly it was really good! Wasn't too floral like Bi Rite. Strawberry thres leeches taste just like any classic strawberry ice cream. I didn't like the Peach cobbler at all. One single scoop of ice cream there is 5$
author: Tina C.

description: So glad Salt & Straw is officially in SF! I've been to their PDX and LA locations before, but this new location is my favorite! We visited on their 2nd day of opening and waited 1 hour and 10 minutes. The line had wrapped around the block! Was it worth the wait?? I think so! The employees were very friendly and patient. :) I had a single scoop of their Caramelized Almond S'mores in a waffle cone. Very tasty! Crunchy yet very smooth. Very filling! The waffle cone was HUGE and unfortunately was a bit stale. No bueno.. :( Prices are a bit more expensive compared to other ice cream shops, but the quality of the ice cream is definitely worth it. Parking is hard to find around the area, but we got lucky that day and found a spot right across the street. Highly recommend visiting Salt & Straw if you haven't been before. I'm sure you will find an ice cream flavor you'll like since they have many to choose from. :)
author: Philana C.

description: LET'S GET ICE CREAM WASTED! Salt & Straw is always worth waiting in line for, especially since I no longer need to go all the way to PDX or LA. You can never go wrong with Peach Vinegar Cobbler with Toasted Nutmeg, Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches, or Sea Salt with Caramel Ribbons. All with waffle cone. Olive Oil flavor is also delicious, but my friends didn't like it (what do they know anyway). I recommend getting at least 2 scoops, otherwise you're not living right.
author: Andrew C.

description: If I could get this place six stars, I would!!! The line was outside of the store, yet luckily we made it to the front 14 minutes before closing! shortly after we walked in and almost to the front of the line Meyreni (hope I spelled her name right) came to take all of our ice cream samples! She kept asking us if we wanted to try more flavors kindly and enthusiastically, even with how busy they were!! All of the flavors are very unique, rich and creamy! :) The atmosphere was very hip and Poppin! Definitely recommend this ice cream spot!
author: Lana H.

description: Late post for July 3rd. The staff was phenomenal the day that I had the opportunity to try their ice cream. The staff kept me and all of the other customers in a pleasant mood despite the long lines. The staff took care of our order while we waited for our turn. We were offered samples before we made our final decision.
author: LM D.

description:
Mass production with 13 locations is not working well for this chain.

Not local.
Not hand made.
Totally over priced.

Empty every time I passed and finally went in to try a small cup so I could charge my phone.  It was just a few bites for a whopping $6 and it was gummy, almost like play dough.  

Sorry but its not for me.  Maybe they should return to their roots and actually make the ice cream by hand.
author: Liz H.

description: AMAZING and worth the wait. Got myself olive oil and lemon curd ice cream on a waffle cone. Loved every lick because I'm a huge lemon dessert fan. I want to go back and try every flavor.
author: Kim L.

description: Is an OMG experience. Everybody needs to know that. Place is cute, service is excellent, even though there's always a lot of people, the line moves fast. But the main reason for the 5 stars is of course the ice cream!! So so good!! I ordered the strawberry tres leches and is to die for, chocolate brownie is delicious and freckled chocolate too. My husband ordered olive oil and lemon and even though he was not sure about that mix when he tried it he loved it. This is definitely a place to visit!
author: Lilliam B.

description: Super bougie ice cream place with crazy prices and crazy flavors. I enjoy the variety and the fact that I can have as many samples as I want. Cool place to check out as a tourist, but expect to spend an unreasonable amount of $$$. Super long lines most of the time, but can be worth it.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Born and raised in the bay I had the great privilege of knowing what good ice cream is. Lol. Eating gelato at my fav spot off of university in Palo Alto to all the many places to choose from in sf. Mitchell's, its its, bi-rite and Humphrey slocumbe. . 

Now coming to this shop for the first time last weekend I didn't have super high expectations. Boy! Did they blow that out of the water. This ice cream is the s*%t! All I could think about and talk about all week. Haha

Parking: it's the city 
Service: amazing they were patient with my indecisive ways lol. (Difficult choices here) they were all very nice
Product: delish (I had the strawberry tres leches and almond brittle)
Price: kinda pricey but not too bad
Overall: I'll be back lol
author: Catherine W.

description:
Salt and Straw gives Humphry Slocombe a run for its money, I think.  Their best flavors are on par with HS's best.  They still need to work out some kinks -- my boyfriend and I both ordered the same size but my scoops were far more generous than his, and the cashier wasn't quite sure how much to charge me for my order, and the line moves more slowly than those at BiRite or Humphry Slocombe -- but the ice cream is amazing.

Line: We came at 3pm on Saturday and waited about 30 minutes in line.  You can also skip the line if you buy a pint ($11).
Ordering: You can buy a split scoop, which gives you two flavors in one scoop.  As a pro tip, you can also get a flight of ice cream (4 smaller scoops, $11.50) and get that split, for a total of 8 flavors.

The actual flavor reviews:

My personal favorites:
Salted Honey Marshmallow and Walnuts -- out of this world.  Baklava is one of my favorite deserts, and this is essentially baklava in ice cream form.
Sea Salt with Caramel Ribbons -- Just as good as it sounds.  This also seems to be their most popular and their recommendation to people who don't know what to get.
Woodblock chocolate -- A great chocolate and their most popular chocolate flavor
Carmelized almond s'mores (temporary flavor) -- Very similar to the honey marshmallow walnut 

Flavors I thought were just OK, but beloved by other people I went with:
Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches -- I thought this was just OK, but it was my boyfriend's favorite flavor.
Peach cobbler -- Again, many folks in my group loved this one, but I thought it was too sweet and cloying

Just OK:
Green apple mayo sherbet (temporary) -- Yeah, I guess.  I can taste the green apple and the mayo and it was fine, but it just wasn't that exciting of a flavor.
Olive oil and lemon -- Fine, but kind of an understated lemon flavor and I've never loved olive oil ice cream to begin with
author: Alex H.

description: I think about this place almost daily. When I saw the line out the door when visiting SF, I thought PSSSH, ice cream is ice cream is ice cream, you dumb sheeple! But regardless I was intrigued, and I went into said line. It was the most flavorful, delicious, light and airy ice cream I have EVER had and I wish I lived closer to it so I could eat some every day.
author: Anne L.

description: glad to have one in sfo . visited new sfo spot today to try honey lavander .it was as good as the one i had while visiting portland.line could be crazy long . went on a friday afternoon got lucky no line at all. they do sell all flavors by pint. if you are a coffee lover  they do sell stumptown coldbrew.
author: Johanna D.

description: bring back the lemon olive oil. that was your best flavor and the only reason i would travel halfway across town twice a week!!!
author: True E.

description: Great variety of flavors, all of them are so yummy! My fave is honey lavender, and the prices are very good for what you get.
author: Pamela L.

description: I've been to the one in LA and this place is just as good. The other ice cream stores better look out and bring their A game. Love their coffee ice cream! Wait in line...it's worth it...
author: Thomas C.

description: The best ice cream in the city! Took a couple of family members from out of town and they loved it! Thanks for Juan for the recommendation!
author: Louie A.

description: Extremely good ice cream. What I especially like are the unconventional flavors - we got zucchini bread, lavender, strawberry with cheeses, and olive oil. One of the only places worth the line.
author: Norcloud S.

description:
Good quality ice cream with some flavor combos that are tasty  - the waffle cones are of great quality as well

I've noticed this "trend" with this kind of ice cream parlor...where they ask you what size scoop you want and...I'm sorry...that's OVERCOMPLICATING ice cream - I'm 48 years old...been going into ice cream shops for a long time - please pick up on LOGICAL SENSE and why traditionally ice cream shops NEVER asked what SIZE of SCOOP - Business/Companies decided how much they could fit into a cone or cup and still be profitable and if the customer wanted more they'd have to buy MORE (another scoop) I mean...who wants LESS then their dollar can buy and fit into the cone or cup? Choose a STANDARDIZED SCOOP SIZE like we've been doing for decades

People just want to tell you how MANY scoops they want and of what

Also...nice story on the website about how this place(s) came to be...but it doesn't answer how it came to be called SALT & STRAW so please disclose that fact so everyone can stop asking without getting an answer
author: Steve S.

description: Amazing ice cream.  Came here at suggestion of a friend and then decided to come back a few more times that week even though it's a 25 min drive from my house.  Flavors are creative and very well executed and the waffle cones are fantastic.  Strawberry Tres Leches, check it out.
author: Brandon F.

description: My wish came true! Went to the one in Portland and wished for it to make its debut in Bay Area. Too bad it's in SF but I'll make the trip out there for their almond brittle with salted ganache. #betterthanbirite
author: Tiffanie W.

description: This is hands down the best experience for getting ice cream. No pressure for how many samples you can have and the flavors are so unique. Wait is long but it's worth it.
author: Grace Z.

description: come here at least once a month to try out new menu. always order $7 two full scoops in a cup. just prepare to wait in line so bring an ipad mini :)
author: Freya-Loki O.

description: Awesome and unique flavors but flavors that work! Clearly they use high quality ingredients as it comes out in the ice cream- yum! Seasonal flavors rotate each month - was bummed to miss the rhubarb crisp but many good ones!
author: J K.

description: Good, but super duper rich, almost too the point of being gaggy. Some of the flavors are so complicated that I think they're trying too hard vs just making delicious ice cream. Having said that, it's the best ice cream in Pac Heights because Smitten is the worst, and the good fro yo places all closed.
author: Nancy R.

description: Love this place! Staff are super friendly and helpful. Try to come in the evenings if possible. During the weekends in the afternoon, lines can wrap around an entire block. Came at 8 p.m. even though there was a small crowd but it moved quickly. I got the Roasted Strawberry (popular flavor) and Honey Lavender. Always get two scoops! Hope they open another location in SF next year.
author: Lanai L.

description: Was very excited about a handmade ice cream place. Was disappointed to read the ingredient list. TAPIOCA AND CARRAGEENAN!!! WHEAT in some others. Sadly, I won't be back. Look up Carrageenan online and see what you think.
author: T W.

description: The service was the best I have ever had in an ice crean restaurant. The ice cream was very tasty. I would rate it 100 stars if I could.
author: Ethan I.

description: One of our favorite ice cream places, as long as you get the sea salt with caramel ribbon flavor.
author: Peter C.

description: This place is delicious! The flavors are curated with such perfection. It's SUPER creamy and sweet, I love it. My favorite is the Strawberry Tres Leches . The line is usually long, but the service is absolutely wonderful and makes it worth it for sure. You can also try flavors before ordering too! I often find myself being indecisive when it comes to ice cream so that is definitely a plus in my book. I heard about this hype and let me tell you, it's real!
author: Linda L.

description: Seriously overrated,  I, like so many others had heard about Salt and Straws imminent arrival and was excited to try yet another artisanal ice cream shop.  I paid almost $8.00 for a single scoop salted caramel and coffee sundae.  Coffee was bitter or burnt and salted caramel over sweet also when ice cream melted it was a watery consistency.  Not my fav, overpriced, better options abound.  Oh and the brownie was terrible, c'mon guys!
author: M M.

description: So thankful that they opened a branch in our neighborhood. Salt & Straw is probably the best new business addition in The Fillmore. So many unique choices and such good quality ice cream. Their staff are over the top friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. So far the Peach Vinegar Cobbler with Toasted Nutmeg is our favorite. I wish them success in their venture. We love ya!
author: Jane F.

description: Best ice cream I've had in a long time! There was a very long line but my kid and I decided to wait. I love that the staff doesn't rush you and offer samples of the ice cream before you buy. Staff was super nice and patient. Definitely will come again.
author: Adriana G.

description: I've been a Salt & Straw fan since moving to Portland 3 years ago.  I moved back to the bay area earlier this year and was excited to find that there was a SF location.  I would take all of my visitors to the Salt & Straw(s) in Portland.  Today, I brought a work colleague that was visiting from Shanghai to this location.  I got her to try a few of my favorite classic flavors and all of the new June flavors.  We decided on 4 for a tasting flight, and when we went to pay, they thanked me for being a repeat customer and gave it to us on the house.  I was shocked to say the least!  I already speak highly of Salt & Straw; this'll be another positive story to add to the many that I have!
author: Simon G.

description: Holy moly, this ice cream is on a-whole-nother level! We went with friends on Memorial Day, and they were open for their normal Monday hours. The line was about 30 mins, but honestly it took me that long to decide which flavor I wanted! In fact, I couldn't decide so I was delighted that you could get 2 half-scoops, so I could get both the Honey Lavender & Woodblock Chocolate. I loved that the chocolate was equally salty and sweet instead of too sweet. It was a great match with the lavender. When we got to the front of the line, the servers were incredibly kind and patient and told us to not feel bad about asking for a bunch of different tastes/samples before we decided and ordered. I wish I could've ordered everything, it was all so complex and delicious!
author: Suzi P.

description: I make my own ice cream, so I felt it was over-priced.  Seriously, my ice cream is just as good, but I lack the  imagination.  I did try the salted caramel and ganache.  The ganache was too bitter against the salted caramel, so I didn't care for that.   If you just want plain chocolate or vanilla, that is not your place to go to.
author: Tracy Q.

description: Omg I love Salt and straw and I am glad one of the places that contributed to my freshman 15lbs in PDX has followed me home to SF!! I love that this location partners with Strauss Family Farm... I can't wait for all the new local flavors that they will release in the near future!!
author: Liana L.

description: Sea Salt and Caramel Vanilla is probably the best thing ever created. Well worth the 11 dollar pint  (and skipping the line).
author: Bobby L.

description: Olive oil and lemon custard was a surprisingly beautiful combo. If you just want a pint, go in and grab one from the fridge. You can cut the line!
author: Nicholas S.

description:
Update: while I stand by everything I said below, we keep coming back here, so I've got to raise it to 4 stars. The flavors that are good are super good. 
--------------

First two visits were great. Great flavors that you can sample. I really liked the peach cobbler and the coffee+chocolate flavor. The prices are premium to match the great flavors. 

Last visit was not as good: 3/4 flavors were just too salty. I don't know if they messed up a batch or if their signature is salty ice cream since their name is Salt and Straw, but I would advise not buying any flavor that you don't taste test first. 

Also the May flavors were great. I'm not quite hip enough for the June upcycled foods flavors, featuring upcycled old popcorn left at the end of the night and banana bread made from leftover old pastries from unknown establishments. The intent is good but this is not for me.
author: Jon R.

description: I tried the peach vinegar cobbler with toasted nutmeg and the banana bread pudding (a June special) flavors. Although the vinegar eventually got a little too strong for me, both flavors were very tasty and intense. My companion had the roasted sunchoke mock apple pie (also a June special flavor) and he really liked it. It did taste like apple pie! Our server was exceptionally friendly and we got in right before the line got really long.
author: Carrie L.

description: Ice  cream. I'm not in the Netherlands so this high calorie delicacy be tried and experienced but never over indulged. This is my person daemon in reviewing  confectioneries. Moderation, but add the hot fudge whenever you can is a rule of thumb!
author: Clinton B.

description: Amazing!! The flavors were un-real! The line was fairly long, but moved quickly. And the scoopers were very helpful and friendly even though everyone, including myself, tried 3 different flavors before making my final decision. The wildflower honey with ricotta walnut laced cookies and chocolate gooey brownie were my favs!
author: Alison W.

description: Delicious. Waffle cone is amazing. Friendly staff. Open late. Got the vanilla. Super good. Strawberry looked good too
author: Louis M.

description: I really didn't want to like this so much because I live two blocks away and I really don't need to be eating ice cream as often as I've been since they opened. I've waited between 20 minutes and 45. I go when I'm not in a rush and I don't care so much about the line. They have a line because you can sample whatever and they don't rush you (although I would personally rush myself to be considerate of others!). I think it would be efficient if they had one person serving scoops and only scoops (no samples) to get the line moving - but I also get that they want people to be happy with the flavor they get. I always get the olive oil and lemon custard. It is just the best. The cobbler ones are also fantastic. Fresh waffle cone? Can't beat it. Writing this review makes me want to get up and go now.
author: Julie T.

description: I tried "chocolate gooey brownies".  It was very rich flavor, which made me very full
author: Ttmi T.

description: Delicious!  Flavors are just as delicious as in Portland, and I loved the SF-focused ingredients in some of their choices.  I had the special May rhubarb crumble and it was lovely--like eating rhubarb pie but creamy and delicious.  We'll definitely be back.  Lines can be long, but service is friendly and efficient, so it moves pretty well.
author: Michelle C.

description: As an ice cream junkie, I've wanted to try this place for YEARS, so I lost my marbles when I stumbled upon this location while visiting SF. It was a 30 minute wait but yes, it was worth it and yes, the honey lavender flavor was everything you'd imagine and more. I've had other honey lavender ice creams before but this one was just different... and that much better. If you love ice cream, I insist you give it a try!
author: Jessie S.

description: Excellent. No complaints. Nice people, great ice cream. I keep going back....
author: Alex B.

description: This place is awesome!! Every ice cream flavor I was attracted to for different reasons but settled on a lemon lace and cookies flavor (limited edition) and the coffee which was delicious!! I was disappointed we only went once during our trip to LA, but I will certainly be back :) this location was nice as the line never really got super long and the staff were really friendly and gave us lots of samples before we committed. This is a definite GO TO if your from out of town.
author: Lizzi L.

description:
This ice cream it's just sweet and a little taste of salt to us.  There's no special taste and flavors to it. We tasted better ice cream like the original Swensen's Ice cream in the corner of Union and Hyde and or Häagen-Dazs.

Not to our taste I guess...
author: E G.

description: Very good ice cream...you can taste several flavors before you order. I got the gooey brownie with salt finishing. It was so delicious.
author: Kayla N.

description: Honey lavender and wildflower honey combo was awesome. Try peach cobbler too. You can try all the flavors if you really wanted
author: Sophia N.

description: We just met Erika and she was the most amazing, welcoming human on the planet. Seems like an exaggerated description but it's true. She let my hubs try as many flavors as he wanted as it was his first time. She was so welcoming and made us feel like her time was ours. Thank you, for the best Ice cream and human love! You make the world a better place!
author: Faith A.

description: So sorry for this after the rave reviews from others. We got two pint to avoid the lines. Sadly there was a long strand of hair in one of our ice cream containers. We could not eat it anymore.
author: Su S.

description: Tried about 5 different flavors before deciding on the peach vinegar cobbler and the strawberry tres leches. Both are amazing, with chunks of real strawberry and peach in the ice cream. I love the creamy texture, and how wonderful all of the flavors are. The staff is super friendly and will let you try anything you like. The best time to go is definitely late at night, an hour or less before it closes, and you won't have to wait in a line of 50+ people. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Jackie S.

description: yum. great flavors to sample, hard to decide because they are all so good but most importantly. customer service is excellent. pretty impressed for this place always being so busy and crazy. keep it up
author: Anile O.

description: I found this place when I came to Portland, Oregon and immediately fell in love with this ice cream shop. I am so excited they opened one in SF! They have very unique flavors. My favorite of all time is the honey lavender on a waffle cone. Btw there waffle cones are freshly made on the spot
author: Tanya S.

description: Probably some of the best ice cream in the country.  One of the scoopers Sebastian had passion and energy from the time I walked through the door,  and I can honesty say I'm really looking forward to going back and trying all of the incredibly creative and unique flavors offered. SF is lucky to finally have a Salt & Straw location in town!
author: David D.

description: I'm not even that big on ice cream, but this place was pretty awesome. Friendly workers, unique flavors, decent environment.
author: Ernest L.

description: Stopped in here yesterday for the first time. I haven't been to any of the other locations like some reviewers, but was still excited to try it as you can smell the sugar from the street. Worth the wait; I got two scoops (one chocolate gooey brownie and one honey lavender). I was surprised by how much I liked the honey lavender! Will definitely be going back to try some of their more interesting flavors.
author: Fiona K.

description: Came here today because I was suggested to visit this place by a good friend. The staff were really friendly and patient. I had the honey lavender and salted marshmallow walnut, both with waffle cone. I was expecting this place to have some crazyyyy flavors like super crazy hahhaha. But it was okay. Maybe I'm just not too big of a fan for sweets but the marshmallow was a little too sweet for me. The honey lavender was okay.
author: J T.

description: CURB YOUR WHEELS ON FILLMORE STREET! Even with a $64.00 Parking Ticket, it was still worth the trek to this new location! This is my 3rd Salt and Straw location visit. Portland and Los Angeles were my first 2. The employees were kind and helpful, I did a split scoop of Almond Brittle w/ Salted Ganache and Sea Salt w/ Caramel Ribbons. The pints to take home were $11.00 each. The waffle cone was "on the house" to make up for my ticket. It was not their fault, but they were sympathetic to my parking woes. I will be back, but will be more careful on that over 3% grade when I park!
author: Lauren F.

description: Olive oil and lemon curd for the win!  Staff was super sweet and offered as many samples as we wanted.  Nice to see salt and straw bringing northwest hospitality to SF.
author: Colson G.

description: Yum. From this lactose intolerant patron this place totally carries super yummy sorbets! Just go on off times since the lines still have not died down on the weekends!
author: michelle z.

description: This is a tough review for me to write so let me disclaim that I'm not the biggest ice cream fan. Please take my review with a grain of salt.  Here are the things I objectively like about S&S, creative flavor combinations, waffles cones!, and competitive prices. The thing I don't like about S&S is the loooooooong line, but the root cause is excellent service by the servers to educate the customers on flavors and the sheer size of the S&S fan base. If you ask someone like me that isn't a huge ice cream fan then it's not worth the wait, but it's definitely worth checking out for the experience. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description: We bought 3 pints-the strawberry tres leches is the best-but when we got home we were shocked to see that some of the pints were packed 3 months ago! WTF?! At $11/pint, I want fresh ice cream. The newest pint was packed on October 3 (today is November 11!). I'll stick to Smitten where it's always fresh.
author: Matt P.

description: It's good, but not worth the wait. If there's no line, go right ahead. But if the line is wrapped around the block, Smitten or BiRite is a much better bet
author: Nam N.

description: Have visited three times so far and have been treated to great ice cream and service each time.  Line is long but moves pretty fast considering how patient they are with you when your time comes to sampling as many flavors as you want before committing.  I'm not usually a fan of floral-flavored food, but am addicted to their honey lavender ice cream - a newfound love thanks to their sampling policy.  Their rotating menu of seasonal flavors keeps things exciting, although have yet to encounter the flavor I had in Portland, pear with blue cheese, which was what got me hooked on the chain in the first place.
author: Jenn L.

description: You cannot go wrong here. Even if you are truly a savory person and don't like sweets, I bet you will find a flavor you love! The best artisanal Ice cream!!! Ever!!!
author: Jenna R.

description: This is the best ice cream ever!!!! This is a must do and totally worth the line! The flavor choices are amazing!
author: Alix V.

description:
from PDX to SF now, third stop after LA.  
current flavor menu: pints $11
first 6 found at all locations: sea salt caramel (a standard popular one), almond brittle salted ganache, double fold vanilla, honey lavender (I don't like potpourri like flavors but delicate), chocolate gooey brownie, freckled woodblock chocolate
but next are specific to SF given the ingredients.
roasted strawberry tres leches (a popular one right now, nice added strawberry)
peach vinegar cobbler w toasted nutmeg -- got this one, excellent
sightglass coffee and single origin dandelion chocolate -- strong coffee
olive oil and lemon custard
salted honey marshmallow and walnuts -- nice
teranga baobab juice and coconut (v) -- not good
seasonals, rotating every first Fri
rhubarb crumble and toasted anise -- enjoyed
wildflower honey and ricotta walnut
rainbow flower sherbet
sarsaparilla dandelion root beer float
raspberry liqueur and edible flower sorbet (v) -- ok
back again for the waffle cone with 2 flavors, soft texture.
author: Rob C.

description: The scent this place gives off is amazing. The place is always packed. The ice cream is just amazing. The hipster crowed really loves this place. I have also been to the Venice loaction and its GREAT!
author: Ariel S.

description: BEST ice cream ever! Love their signature flavor -- sea salt with caramel ribbons! I could eat it everyday!!
author: hilary j.

description: You will not like any other ice cream once you have it here. Sea salt almond brittle is a must try. Also the brownie one is good. Amazinggg place and must try for ice cream lovers.
author: Shraddha A.

description: Nothing special, very average flavors and texture you can get at many ice cream shops. Not worth the wait, enjoy the line
author: Ifred M.

description: This is the best ice cream in the area. The line is long but it moves quickly. My favorite flavors are the almond brittle and sea salt with caramel but they let you taste quite a few. Definitely get two scoops and the waffle cone!
author: Laura T.

description: Always such creative flavors that meld together so nicely. And they encourage you to taste various flavors before choosing your final flavor. Customer service is wonderful and they all are very well versed in the flavor combos. I have visited the SF and the Portland locations and on both occasions, lines out the door so be prepared to wait, but it is worth it.
author: Christy D.

description: The line is worth the wait.  They let you sample whatever flavors you would like. The homemade waffle cones delicious and cooked exactly right. They have unique flavors that change month to month that make it exciting to keep coming back and see what the have.
author: Chlo Chlo C.

description: Since their opening, every time I passed this place, there was a line. Finally we decided to see what the draw was. Hats off to the counter staff for their friendliness and patience with the long lines and people asking for tasting spoons of at least 2-3 flavors before making a selection. The caramel was too sweet for me as was the lemon custard and honey. It is an EXPENSIVE treat and glad we had the experience this one time. For first timers, it's a good first date location.
author: Veronica L.

description: Not sure what all the hype is.  Friends raved about this place and we waited in line, yes, in line for ice cream.  Flavors were unique, but I have to say, was underwhelmed. And, outrageous priced!  $5 for a small scoop?  The Salt and Carmel was waaayyy too salty.  There's a bubble for sure in SF.  I won't be back here.  There are as good as options in Safeway.
author: Carla M.

description: It was ok. Really long lines but it wasn't worth the wait. There's lots of other ice cream places that are better in my opinion.
author: Emma S.

description: Awesome flavors, friendly staff, there's always a line but it moves relatively quickly so don't be deterred.
author: Kimberly N.

description: As usual, friends took me to another hyped dessert place. I tried the peach cobbler and it was pretty awesome. The lines can get long so try to go early.  You do get to try to taste a few before ordering. I would recommend tasting what you decide to order because some times the flavors are a little bit different from what you expect (IE, carrot cake).
author: Frederick C.

description: Yum!  Went to Salt and Straw in Portland, and was excited to visit once they opened up in SF.  Didn't disappoint!
author: Herb G.

description: Coconut milkshake was the BOMB!!! Great customer service too!
author: Ed C.

description: Walked by this place last Monday and for the first time there was no line around the corner, probably because I took the day off and I'm never on Fillmore at 3pm on a Monday. I was greeted by a really nice woman named LENA (sp?). She was incredibly friendly and let me try as many flavors as I wanted. Not only was the customer service AMAZING but every single flavor I tried was delightful. I ended up getting the honey lavender which was out of this world delicious! Thank you Lena!
author: Emma W.

description: Flavors had ridiculously long names and lacked depth to the their actual flavor.... less effort should be put into the name and pitch. Good ice cream doesn't need an explanation.
author: Jav V.

description: Came in for the first time last night after hearing how amazing this place is. I'm not a huge ice cream fanatic, so was skeptical. We sampled the salted caramel, strawberry rhubarb, vanilla, olive oil lemon custard, and root beer float flavors. All were delicious, but my top two were olive oil lemon and salted caramel, which we ordered cones of. This ice cream is expensive and the lines are long, but it's honestly worth it. And I'm not even someone who particularly loves ice cream -- it's typically too sweet for my taste -- but what I love about this place is that they offer complex savory/salty flavors that seem to be a little lighter on the sugar spectrum. Also, the service is terrific and friendly. Will be back! I actually just sent my husband over there again this evening to pick up a few pints for our freezer along with the cones (they offer their sugar cones for free with sale of pints and their waffle cones are $1 each).
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Amazing ice cream and kick ass customer sercice.  They let you try as many flavors as you like.
author: Victor S.

description: Thank you for expanding out of Oregon!  We can't get enough of your endless creativity!  Goat cheese marionberry habanero is a surprise combination of tastes all in one scoop, all complementing each other.  Then there's meyer lemon buttermilk with blueberries with just the right combination of sweet-tart.  Honey lavender is delicate and soothing.  And, you'll never want a cone made elsewhere.  We had the chance to learn about the whole, thoughtful process at a Ferry Building class.  Plus, we now know how they give back to community in special leadership trainings at HQ.  What can we say---these are scoops with SOUL!
author: Paula H.

description: Wow!! So happy to have stumbled across this place. I'm not sure how long they have been in business, hopefully I haven't been missing out for too long. The line moved fairy quickly so no complaints there. The ice cream was wonderful, and my partners coconut milkshake was delicious. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Thank you!
author: Vanessa B.

description: Delicious ice cream and super friendly staff. I tried a bunch of flavors, and then went with good old vanilla (they do the best vanilla ever!)
author: K. D.

description: I appreciate their unique flavors. The ice cream is rich and dense compared to most brands. It's almost like gelato which I also like.
author: Peter R.

description: Incredible Ice cream! I can't get enough of the peach cobbler flavor.  Great service. Don't be discouraged by the line, it goes by fast and worth the wait.
author: Ari F.

description: Waited in a long line, and I was disappointed. I threw my ice cream away. I should have taken a taster sample, but they were too busy. I had cheese and strawberries. The strawberry was jam that you buy in the store. I was expecting fresh frozen strawberries no jam. The cheese was the risk and it was bitter. Not a good combo in my opinion. My daughter had the sherbet and she liked it so hence the two stars. I have had better so it is not worth the wait.
author: N B.

description: This place is always cracking, so much selection and you can sample all you want! They have the oddest flavors, but those are sometimes the best!
author: Cody L.

description: Just stopped by for the first time. The line was pretty long, but it's definitely worth the wait. I never experienced such amazing customer service at a creamery. Violet let us try as many flavors as we wanted and despite the line, she was incredibly patient and educated us on each flavor. More importantly, she was just a a kind person, who had a genuine interest in creating an amazing experience for customers. Check it out and be patient, but it's worth it- I promise! Did I mention that every flavor is delicious!!!
author: Madullah N.

description: Overpriced, overly complicated, very disappointing. There are 6 other ice cream parlors within walking distance. Don't waste your time waiting in line here.
author: Stanley R.

description: Disappointed that they don't use organic ingredients and even more disappointed that they use the nasty food additive carrageenan which  has been removed from a lot of foods because it causes major inflammation.  At $11 a pint I would expect only the highest quality ingredients.
author: Goli M.

description: I don't get why this place is so popular.  The ice cream itself is pretty meh, although the people are nice and they are very generous with samples.  Definitely not a place I would wait in line for.
author: Tom N.

description: I didn't mind waiting in a 45 min line because it was that good!! They gave me 4 samples and all were delicious. I appreciated the unique flavors/combinations. I don't eat ice cream often but I definitely see myself going here anytime I'm craving ice cream!
author: Shilps S.

description:
There is nothing special about this place, and I expect the long lines to dissipate once the novelty has passed.  You will wait for about 30 minutes...the line always seems to be about the same length whenever I pass by.  The classic and seasonal flavor descriptions seem tantalizing.  The interior is a drab beige and the design looks strangely cheap and "homemade crafty", considering it's a newly renovated location.  They offer a "tasting flight", which may be the best idea ever in terms of ice cream service:  4 single scoops placed in glass bowls on custom wood presentation board.  

I tried:  1.  Freckled Woodblock Chocolate:  tasted somewhat blunted and dusty and lacked chocolate intensity;  the salt and over-sweetness of the base was distracting and left me wanting a sip of water.  2.  Roasted Strawberry Tres Leches:  lots of strawberries, which was nice, but the base with chunks of cake was so sweet and indistinct it basically tasted like a generic "strawberry cheesecake" supermarket ice cream.  3.  Peach Vinegar Cobbler with Toasted Nutmeg:  I'm not sure the nutmeg was toasted, but it was definitely a nice forward flavor;  this was probably my favorite of the 4 tasted, but it did still suffer a bit from too much sugar.  4. Wildflower Honey with Ricotta Lace Cookies:  I was hoping for a simple, floral honey flavor, but got instead a whack of sugar, strangely strong lemony ricotta flavor and alot of chewy raw tasting oats;  not bad, just not at all what I expected. 

Overall, this ice cream suffers because the base is too sweet, too salty and too distracting.  I feel like someone has spit into my mouth a weird semi salty mucous.  You lose the purity of the flavor and the freshness of dairy.  You would do better to walk 1 block down Fillmore to California and visit Smitten, where the ice cream is still too sweet, but you will get more freshness and the simple goodness of milk and cream is more evident.
author: Andrew W.

description: I was pretty impressed by their ice cream options - unique and delicious. In spite of long line, we were served quickly and efficiently and with a friendly smile on their face. Will definitely be back and will tell my friends about this place
author: Amanda F.

description: Ice cream worth the wait but can't believe they let all the dogs inside. I find that gross especially when employee reached over and pet the dog
author: Donna L.

description: They're so nice about letting you sample multiple flavors! The strawberry tres leches taste like a strawberry cheesecake in ice cream form. I ended up getting a scoop of the almond brittle flavor which was amazing! So creamy and delicious, yes it's $5.00 for a small scoop but def worth the splurge.
author: Liv T.

description: Have you ever wondered what all the hype was about something and then experienced it for yourself and then still wondered? That's what happened with me and this place. It's ice cream. Ice cream tastes good. That's what ice cream does. This place isn't anything special though. And now the entire intersection has an overbearing odor of sweetener.
author: G G.

description: little too sweet and although the flavors were very unique, it was just ok.  icecream seemed like it was little on the melted side as well.
author: Mac Y.

description: unique ice cream tastes and a very friendly staff , a little over priced and there is a line sometimes but i really enjoyed the ice cream !
author: Dorin C.
